dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspaper bag slung over his shoulder, DAVEY ARMSTRONG (1 cruises down the bucolic suburban street on his BMX. All need to know about the bright-eyed Davey is plastered on tee-shirt: “AREA 51 - I BELIEVE."

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Just past the manicured lawns and friendly waves, go inside any house. Less than fifty feet from where you sleep, entirely different lives are playing out. He watches his NEIGHBORS with curiosity. PEOPLE are out d yard work. KIDS are playing in the street. DAVEY PEELS UP TO A MAILBOX. Grabs a paper -- Accidentall DROPS IT revealing THE FRONT PAGE. A PICTURE OF A BOY (13 beneath the headline, “NEWBURYPORT BOY STILL MISSING."

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Behind the freshly painted walls next door, anything could be happening and you'd never know. Davey’s eyes gleam at the headline as he scoops up the pa stuffs it into the mailbox. Speeds away... AS HE PEDALS ALONG, Davey surveys the NEIGHBORS he passes

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Even serial killers live next door to somebody...  2. A BALDING NEIGHBOR (40s) mows his lawn. Waves at Davey as Davey passes. Davey politely smiles, waves back. But as s as the neighbor isn’t looking, Davey’s eyes turn skeptica A YOUNG COUPLE argues with one another -- Stop at the sig of Davey zipping past. Smile as he goes by. A facade. AROUND THE BEND, a shirtless YOUNG MAN (20) we’ll come to know as KYLE washes his TRANS-AM. Sees Davey. Flips him o

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But that’s what I love about it. It always keeps you on your toes. Davey pulls over to another mailbox at the foot of a long driveway that leads to a well-maintained two-story coloni It reads "MACKEY."

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When something you never saw coming breaks the routine... that’s when things get really interesting. Davey opens the mailbox, stuffs a paper inside -- MAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Davey! Hey, bud -- What’s going on? Davey looks up to find WAYNE MACKEY (40s) walking down th driveway toward him. He’s your average suburban bachelor: little tall, athletic shoulders, kind eyes. Type of guy w should have a family by now but doesn’t seem in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Mackey... Davey scans Mackey. Sees his clothes are covered in --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What’s with all the dirt?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Oh -- Ha. Yeah. Been doing some planting in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There was no cash in your mailbox yesterday. For the paper.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Has it been a month already? Jeez... Actually, I was gonna ask if you had a sec to help me lift something inside? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can grab the money too. Kill two birds with one stone? INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Davey scans Mackey’s FAMILY PHOTOS while Mackey goes thro drawers in the kitchen. FROM AN END TABLE, Davey picks up a FRAMED PHOTO of a smi TEENAGE BOY and his PARENTS. Mackey comes up behind Davey. Hands him a $5 bill.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Knew I had it. Here ya go...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’ve got a big family, huh? Mackey scans all the pictures on the walls, tables...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, just make sure you don’t live too close to em or they’1ll always be in your business, am I right? Mackey moves to a WOODEN BUREAU. Slaps a hand on its top.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: This is it. Bought some new furniture for upstairs. Need to get this hunka junk down into the basement. Think we can manage it? INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - MOMENTS LATER Mackey and Davey carry the bureau down the stairs. Davey struggles -- He’s clearly bitten off the max he can chew.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Watch your step... As they level out on the concrete basement floor, pass a large furnace -- KACHUNK! -- It KICKS ON, scaring Davey - WHAM! He drops the bureau --

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shit. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long as you didn’t get your foot, it’s fine. We can rest a sec. Davey appraises the UNFINISHED BASEMENT. Two dangling lig bulbs throw stark shadows against the sheetrock walls tha enclose THREE ROOMS.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Really appreciate the help. Flip side of not living near family -- no one’s ever around to help out. Davey points to a cracked door. BLOOD RED LIGHT EMANATES behind it. Kinda creepy...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What’s in there?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: That’s where we’re going. Think you can make it the rest of the way? Davey nods. They hoist the bureau again. He spots a PADLO ON THE DOOR IN THE CORNER. Odd. Then they’re moving -- INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT DARK ROOM - MOMENTS LATER -- THUD! Davey and Mackey put down the bureau...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Heavy sonofabitch, huh...? .. leaving Davey HUFFING AND PUFFING. Mackey CHUCKLES. He looks oddly disturbing in the red glow. Everything does.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: So, whattaya think? Putting the finishing touches on my dark room. Sort of an amateur photographer. Figured this beast would be good to store some equipment.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That’s cool. I’m sort of an amateur videographer, so I get it...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Just like your old man. Boy, I remember your parents walking you around the block in a stroller. Now look at you. How old are ya anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Fourteen? Shit. Perfect age. Wish I could just freeze it for you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Anyway, I gotta get home for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Of course. I can take it from here. Send your folks my best. Davey nods, heads back up the basement stairs as THE SOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crystal clear New England summer night. Dense forest bu up against the backyards of FIVE HOUSES that line a cul-d sac, each home separated by a sizeable yard. NUMEROUS FLASHLIGHT BEAMS slice through the darkness. A commotion of some sort. A search? No, it’s --

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGED BOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (echoing, from a distance) Manhunt! We’re coming to get you shitheads! AS WE SWOOP DOWN, we find Davey running through a neighbo pitch black backyard, dressed in all dark clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Go-go-go! A few other KIDS (12-15), also dressed in dark clothing, scatter in all directions, looking for hiding spots. WE STAY WITH DAVEY as he bolts into what we recognize as MACKEY’S BACKYARD. Ducks behind a thick bush up against Mackey’s house. Looks around. Doesn’t see anyone --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Move over! DAVEY JUMPS, turns to find CURTIS FARRADAY (14), AKA “FARRADAY," his nerdy friend, squeezing in behind the bus Farraday's the kid puberty left behind -- high-pitched vo and about a head shorter than Davey with horn-rimmed glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell, Farraday? Find your own spot! You’re gonna get us caught!

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: This is my spot!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Not right now -- Go! Annoyed, Farraday slinks away. Davey listens. No movement Then HE HEARS MUFFLED, INDISCERNIBLE VOICES coming from - INSIDE MACKEY’S HOUSE. Davey peeks into the window to fin MACKEY, PHONE at his ear, sitting across the dining room table from a TEENAGED KID (13). Scraggly red hair, acne, freckles, GREEN ATARI shirt. Davey doesn’t recognize him. Mackey shrugs apologetically, hangs up. No one answered. redhead nods, and Mackey says something that makes him LA They head into another room and out of Davey’s sight...

dialogues.speaker: GOT YOU, DUDE
dialogues.text: Davey recoils as FLASHLIGHT BEAMS NAIL him. Squints past light to find DALE WOODWORTH, AKA, “WOODY” (14) and TOMMY EATON, AKA, “EATS” (14) smiling down at him, victorious.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Woody! Woody’s a bear of a kid. The opposite of Farraday -- Pube came fast and furious. Eats is the punk of the group. Lik character out of The Ramones. A wise-ass through and thro

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hiding in Farraday’s spot, man? Lame. You're better than that.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Davey, treehouse in fifteen. After we catch this little bitch.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He’s close. I can practically smell the Noxzema on him. As Woody and Eats dash into the night to continue the sea Davey peers back into Mackey’s window. All’s quiet.  EXT. EATS’ HOUSE - SIDE YARD - NIGHT A TREEHOUSE hangs in the limbs of a maple beside a classi colonial house. A light glows inside as --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can’t wait to get laid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody’s got a PORNO MAG in hand, Davey and Farraday on ei side of him. Woody and Farraday look particularly intoxic by the pictures of beautiful, NAKED WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Aren’t you guys sick of looking at those same chicks? Sitting across from them, Eats sips from a flask.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shit no, man.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: or even just feel-up a chick.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Second base? That’s it? I rounded third once. She was hot, too.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Just so happens to be a girl none of us knows --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I was on vacation, dipshit.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: How convenient...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'd be happy just to get on base with Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Oh, man. How is she so friggin hot?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Too bad she’s into my brother.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Kyle!? No way! He’s twenty and he works at the hardware store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When’s he getting us more pornos? The pages on this one are wearing off --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I told you, he said we can go fuck ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Tell him we’re trying to. That’s why we need the porno mags. The guys all have a LAUGH as Eats passes the flask to Woo Woody takes a sip -- COUGHS, GAGS --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Thank God for this treehouse. Wish I could just live up here instead of with my mom...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I dunno how safe that’d be. With those kids going missing --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Come on, we all know what you’re gonna say. “It’s a conspiracy. It’s all connected. The disappearances aren’t random, they’re part of some vast governmental alien cover-up.” Right? Davey just stares at him a moment, not wanting to admit h right, but --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So you don't think it's weird? Last summer, a kid goes missing in Hamilton. Now another kid disappears in Newburyport...? Eats and Farraday LAUGH. Davey looks to Woody for support

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Davey, you're my best friend, but you sound like a nutjob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when he connected a Lite Brite to his keyboard to try and communicate with extraterrestrials?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Or when he swore there was a demonic presence in his room cuz our houses were built on Indian burial grounds?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That was like... three years ago! And our houses were built on an Indian burial ground --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: There’s literally no proof of that --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: All right, are we done here? I gotta beat off before my parents get home.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Oh shit, good call. I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You guys are animals... As Davey follows Farraday down the ladder, Eats grabs at porn mag in Woody’s hand, but Woody won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No way! Thought you were tired of looking at these same chicks.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I am. Why ya think I stopped bangin your mom?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You're dead! Woody grabs Eats, they wrestle playfully as we -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - LATER The room is literally wallpapered with the front pages of various tabloids: “Satanic Cult Abducting Children," “I w Bigfoot’s Love Slave,” “Back from the Dead -- For Two Yea was a Zombie," “Are UFOs Abducting Cows?” etc... Davey’s in bed reading “THE HARDY BOYS: THE SHORE ROAD MYSTERY." His mother, SHEILA (40s), enters.  10. She has the big hair and business suit of a career woman, the gentle nature of a mom. She fixes his covers, takes t book away.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You know you shouldn't read this stuff before bedtime. Scary dreams.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mom, I’m fourteen. You don’t need to tuck me in anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't need me to. Doesn't mean I'm ready to give it up. She kisses him on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Think Dad's gonna be home soon?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I don't know, hon. You know how the news is. Always something going on that needs reporting. Sleep tight. Sheila flicks off his bedroom light, closes his door. As as she’s gone, Davey reaches under his bed, pulls out a G ROBOT STARCODE WALKIE TALKIE. Speaks softly --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys, Roller Palace tomorrow? Davey hops out of bed. Grabs the BINOCULARS from his nightstand and walks to the window ON THE OTHER SIDE OF H ROOM. Pulls aside the curtains THAT FACE THE HOUSE NEXT D BINOCULARS POV: A dimly-lit room. We can just barely make the shape of a bed, a nightstand...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Scope some cuties? I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hope that chick from last week is there. She was all over me.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You asked to touch her boobs and she threw you over the railing. Davey scans the other windows, but the neighboring house empty. No signs of life. He couldn’t be more disappointed  11.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bet I didn’t look half as dumb as Davey every time he sees Nikki in the DJ booth and bites it. Davey’s disappointment suddenly turns to a devilish smile

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Know what doesn’t bite? The fact that I can see her right now... Naked...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If you're serious, I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Holy shit, she’s waving for me to come over --

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, now I know you’re full of it. Eats, out.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd trade both my nuts to have that view. She's like your private dancer. (singing) "A dancer for money. Do what you want her to dooooo."

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tina Turner? I fuckin love her!

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude, me too! I mean, I know we're technically not her demographic but -- CLICK! Davey turns off his walkie, rolls his eyes. Return bed and looks out the LARGE PICTURE WINDOW AT HIS BEDSIDE the entire cul-de-sac. The perfect view. He grabs his -- BINOCULARS POV: Davey’s magnified gaze scans the other ho in the cul-de-sac, finally landing on MACKEY’S HOUSE DIRE ACROSS THE STREET. No lights on. Nothing out of the ordin Davey hops back in bed, pulls the covers over his head as

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: We HEAR RUSTLING, then... A RING OF LIGHT becomes a FLOOD ILLUMINATION, revealing we’re --  12. INSIDE A GARBAGE CAN, LOOKING UP AT DAVEY as he drops a L GARBAGE BAG down onto us -- EXT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - DAY Davey drops the lid back into place, covering his nose. REFUSE is strewn across the deck around three garbage can one of which is still knocked over. He looks over the extraordinary mess and SIGHS. Pulls on YELLOW RUBBER GLOV

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can you at least make Mom double-bag her meatloaf when she tosses it? Smells like werewolf crap. Davey’s father RANDALL (40s) supervises from the patio ta where he cleans the detached lens from a professional gra BETAMAX CAMCORDER. CHANNEL SIX NEWS emblazoned on the sid

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: If you remembered to put the cinder blocks on those bins like I told you, we wouldn’t have this mess.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I hate raccoons. You should do an exclusive. Get pest control in here. I could film it...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Yeah, nice try. Camcorder’s off- limits. It’s --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: -- expensive, I know. How am I supposed to become the next Spielberg if I don’t practice? Randall gives an amused smirk. CLICKS the lens back in pl and heads for the patio door.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Just make sure this patio’s clean before you go anywhere, capiche?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their BMX bikes, clearly on a mission, bags of candy i hand, the boys zip through the picturesque seaside downto brushing past outraged PEDESTRIANS...  13.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: A roller skating rink, parking lot filled. The SOUNDS of Bananarama’s “CRUEL SUMMER" bleed into the night from ins as the guys roll up on their bikes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC POUNDS THE AIR as round and round the rink goes crowd of TEEN ROLLERSKATERS. Nearly in slow-motion, a GORGEOUS TEEN GIRL glides past as... Davey, Eats, Farraday and Woody stare, slack-jawed. Eats nearly trips, almost takes Woody with him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Control yourself, ya psycho!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I can't -- I got needs, Woody! They all LAUGH as Davey’s gaze floats up to the DJ in the booth overlooking the floor. NIKKI KASZUBA (17) bobs her head as she searches through stack of VINYLS for a next song. Glaringly hot and aloof, she’s the kind of girl guys throw their virginity at. Davey stares up at her dreamily, slowing his roll. The gu track his gaze. And now they’re all entranced.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Nikki Kaszuba. She’s like, scientifically the perfect woman.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: If she was my sitter I'da been bangin her the second my balls dropped.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Was it hard not to pop a boner every time she gave you a bath?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It was four years ago, not ten. Calm down. We just played games and shit.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: What kind of games? Naughty games?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I hate you guys... Davey skates off toward the --  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey skates out of the bathroom drying his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Now you’re spying on me here too? Davey’s eyes go wide -- It’s Nikki! And she knows! words come out because HOLY SHIT IS THIS GIRL HOT!

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know you pervs spy on me. Davey’s heart is hammering in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Nothing to say? Really?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, I just -- I never watch when you're -- I mean, I don’t mean to watch you, you’re just --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I’m just what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: perfect. But But no The anger on Nikki’s face dissipates. She lets Davey go, skates off. Davey watches after her, the weight of what j happened sinking in. What did I just say!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey rolls up on the other guys, who are plainly staring the asses of a GROUP OF OBLIVIOUS GIRLS a few feet ahead. still looks like he’s in shock.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: The hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Huh? Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You sure? We were worried maybe you got kidnapped or something.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’re such an asshole.  15.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Coming from you, that’s a compliment. Now, watch as I show you dicknoses how to score with the ladies... Eats speeds toward the group of oblivious girls. The guys quicken their pace to catch up, but as Davey rounds the l past the DJ booth, he glances up to find NIKKI LOOKING BA AT HIM. THE MOMENT LASTS AN ETERNITY. SHE SMIRKS! Then -- WHAM! Davey trips, takes a ridiculous spill, skin SCREECH on the wood. A few SKATERS trip over him, causing a pile- IN THE DJ BOOTH, Nikki plays the famous sound bite from T Surfaris’ “WIPE OUT.” LAUGHTER fills the air as we -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Davey’s family sits around the TV eating dinner off TV TR ON THE TV, a NEWS ANCHOR (40s) talks Summer Olympics...

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: now confirmed that 14 Eastern Bloc countries, including the Soviet Union, will boycott the Olympic Games in Los Angeles later this summer...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. Cold War's never gonna end. Davey, your future’s doomed. Sheila hands a thick folder off the end table to Randall.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: John dropped these off today.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Ah, great. Must be the fliers for the block party. Randall opens it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Yup. They got a Beatles cover band to play this year. Pretty neato.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nikki’s not DJing like last year? She’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Probably not in the cards, what with her parents getting a divorce.  16. Davey blanches as his heart drops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nikki’s parents are getting divorced?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Where’d you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Bob Burnquist bowls with Mike Kaszuba. Said it’s pretty ugly. Supposedly, Mike’s not even living in the house right now.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Let’s not gossip, Randall... (thinking about it) But that’s awful. I never would’ve thought they were having problems.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: That’s why they invented curtains, hon.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Well, enough about that. At least the block party sounds like it’1ll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but why’s it always like the last weekend before school starts?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: That’s kinda the point, pal. Say goodbye to summer fun with a bang. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - A SHORT TIME LATER Mind still on Nikki, Davey grabs his binoculars. Goes to side window and cautiously looks out at -- BINOCULARS POV: Nikki’s bedroom window. The lights are on but no one’s there. Davey focuses in on a FRAMED PHOTO on bedside table. It’s of Nikki and her MOM and DAD. Davey lowers the binoculars, saddened as -- BRRRING! The HOUSE PHONE RINGS. Davey hurries into the -- HALLWAY. Grabs the phone off the wall. Before he can answ he hears VOICES ON THE LINE. He’s about to hang up when -  17.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wanna tell me what’s so urgent I can’t just come in tomorrow? The UNKNOWN CALLER SIGHS, unsure how to say that --

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Randall, it’s -- The Chronicle received a letter from some guy calling himself the “Cape Ann Killer.” Claims he’s killed thirteen teenaged boys over the last decade. Davey’s eyes go wide. A moment of silence passes on the l

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s legit. Story’s gonna break any second. We need ya in here, pronto. BACK IN HIS ROOM. Davey grabs the walkie-talkie as the VO OF HIS PARENTS ECHO UP FROM DOWNSTAIRS. The front door SL

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys! Something big is going down!

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Someone’s going down on who?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: I was right. Know those missing boys? It’s a serial killer! My dad just got called in!

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy shit, you’re not kidding. It’s on the news right now. Davey drops the walkie-talkie and races back down to the INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Sheila’s standing in front of the TV, remote control clut firmly to her chest. Davey sees the LIVE PRESS CONFERENCE where DEPUTY SHERIFF LEWIS CALDWELL (50) addresses REPORT

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: This afternoon, the Cape Ann Chronicle received an anonymous letter from someone claiming responsibility for the deaths of thirteen teenaged boys. Davey can’t believe what he’s hearing. He looks at Sheila She watches in stunned silence.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: The author also provided a list of names, dates and pertinent details related to a number of open missing persons cases. We’ve confirmed the accuracy of these statements and can now officially label this person an active serial killer. ON SCREEN, the feed cuts back to the IN-STUDIO NEWS ANCHO

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: Sheriff's office reports they're likely looking for a white male in his late-30s to 40s, living alone. Preferred targets appear to be males, aged 12 to 16 -- CLICK. Sheila turns off the TV. Knuckles white on the rem Tense silence fills the void, until --

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I just, I can’t believe something -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - LATER CLOSE ON Davey’s face, a familiar glimmer in his eye --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: -- like this could happen here! It could be anybody! This is the coolest thing that’s ever happened to us! All four guys are here, though from their HUSHED VOICES, obvious they’re not supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: They said he hunts guys our age. Think maybe we should cool it with the late night Manhunts?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Why? None of the missing kids are from Ipswich. And Cape Ann's wicked big --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s not that big. How’re you not freaking out that something’s finally happening in this town?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Because there’s no way it’s gonna hit us or this neighborhood. We love you, man, but look at this place.  19. The guys scan the room: an “Area 51” poster hangs on the beside a large framed still of the classic Patterson-Giml Big Foot video. Alien figurines and toys cover most surfa A large cross adorns a wall, garlic hanging from it.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You’re desperate for crazy shit to happen. You hear a news story and suddenly every boogeyman in these magazines lives down the street. Farraday grabs the BINOCULARS. Looks out the SIDE WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me for being the only one to hear there’s a serial killer on the loose in Cape Ann and get a --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Boner! Holy shit! All the guys crowd to the window to follow Farraday’s gaz Could only be one thing. Eats scrambles to grab the extra of BINOCULARS Davey keeps near the window.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Move over, Woody! Fat ass! Eats ducks down at Woody’s knees, and as the four adolesc guys gaze out, WE SEE -- BINOCULARS POV: NIKKI, IN HER WINDOW. Undressing. Her bac our boys, she slips off her bra. Sunkissed skin, the grac curves of her shoulders and bare neck achingly feminine.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I bet her hair smells like Vidal Sassoon.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Definitely. If I was over there right now, she’d be pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Guys, show her a little respect. Her parents are getting divorced. A moment of silence passes... Then --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Statistically that means she’s, like, 78 percent more likely to engage in pre-marital sex.  20.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You guys are disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Whatever, dude, you were thinking it.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Bank it and spank it. Woody wrestles the binoculars from Farraday, SNEAKS A PEE for himself. His jaw instantly drops.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I feel like I just discovered the meaning of life. Davey, you gotta get with her, man. Davey looks out at Nikki with a look of pure intoxication It’s not lust in his eyes, it’s something more. Until -- NIKKI SPINS -- REALIZES SHE’S BEING WATCHED!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Shit-get-down! The guys drop to the floor, BUT DAVEY’S FROZEN. He meets Nikki’s gaze --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude...! Woody yanks him to the floor and OUT OF FRAME. Far too la

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m so fucked... EXT. FARRADAY’S HOUSE - ESTABLISHING - DAY Another upper-middle-class, two-story colonial on the cul sac. We can see Davey’s house a couple driveways over. INT. FARRADAY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Stuffing sandwiches in their faces, Farraday and Davey ho over a newspaper. The headline reads, “THE CAPE ANN KILLE 15 CONFIRMED VICTIMS AND COUNTING.”

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The Cape Ann Killer. So rad. Dude, look at this -- Davey runs his finger along a PHOTO of the killer’s lette It includes a LIST OF NAMES. The victims. Right there in black and white, next to the info hotline number.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Now that we have their names, I bet we can find details of their disappearances at the library --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Absolutely not! FRANCINE FARRADAY (40s), sets a bowl of Doritos between t boys. Just looking at her, you can see the conservative, razor-sharp intellect of a clinical psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: And if I find out you did, I’m calling your mother, David. Besides, Curtis has homework.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: So stupid. Everyone else gets to hang out all summer. I hate the academy --

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: My son is not going to be the first Farraday without a Ph.D. from an Ivy League school. Period. CURTIS FARRADAY, SR. joins the boys at the table with a salad. He stabs a finger onto the paper. CURTIS SR. Makes me sick. The media supporting the name this psychopath gave himself like he’s in the damn World Wrestling Federation. Whoever he is, he’s clearly deranged and beyond help.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: All serial killers are beyond help. That’s why they’re serial killers. They can't stop themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Why do they call em serial killers?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: “Serial” just means “many.” So it’s someone who’s driven to murder multiple people over many years. CURTIS SR. We’ve both done some research into the subject. Francine more than me.  22.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can you tell us about some of em?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t think it’s appropriate. CURTIS SR. If they don’t hear it from us, Dear, you can be sure they’1l learn about it from the G.D. news... Francine considers. Nods agreement.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Well, this country’s seen its fair share. H.H. Holmes was the first one documented. Built a hotel in Chicago. Called it his “Murder Castle.” CURTIS SR. No one knows how many people he killed there. Probably hundreds. Davey and Farraday’s eyes light up like the fourth of Jul CURTIS SR. Then there’s Ed Kemper, “The Co-Ed Killer.” John Wayne Gacy, “The Killer Clown.” Guy actually dressed up like a clown for the kids in his neighborhood. Never trust a clown.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Ted Bundy, “The Lady Killer.” My favorite.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Mom...! Gross!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Meaning he’s fascinating. He confessed to murdering thirty women. Used his good looks to seduce, kidnap and kill his victims. Some serials even keep items from their victims, which we call “trophies.” These are deeply disturbed individuals. CURTIS SR. The list goes on and on. All with sensational names to sell newspapers and gain ratings. The news media disgusts me. No offense to your father, Davey.  23.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But why would the Killer write this letter after all this time?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: To raise the stakes. Make it more of a thrill, and show how confident he is that he won’t be caught. He thinks he’s smarter than the police, and he’s trying to prove it. Francine scoops the newspaper off of the counter. Peers d at it, shaking her head in disgust as she walks over...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: We thought this town was insulated from all the madness out there. But even Ipswich isn’t safe anymore... and drops it into the trash bin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mere feet away from an oblivious OLD WOMAN (70s), Eats jokingly humps a bookcase. Ipswich isn’t safe anymore ind He’s got Woody in stitches as nearby --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Guys, cut the shit! Unlike you, I actually come here to study so don't get me kicked out. NEWSPAPER from Farraday's house on his lap, Davey sits at MICROFICHE MACHINE. Farraday loads in a SHEET. Maneuvers through pages of OLD NEWSPAPER ARTICLES.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Just use these knobs to scroll, find the articles you want. Easy... Davey takes the wheel. Uses the current paper as referenc Starts searching for VICTIMS’ NAMES. AS HE SCROLLS, WE SE

dialogues.speaker: A BLOND BOY .... A FAT BOY .... A SHAGGY BOY .... MORE BO
dialogues.text: ALL TEENAGERS. And then a break in the pattern --

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF EVERY CHAIR.
dialogues.text: TIME FLIES BY as one by one, he crosses names off the lis  24.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I can’t look at this stuff anymore. Farraday gets up and walks off. But Davey’s eyes are wide with morbid fascination. HE’S HOOKED. WE SEE MORE GROTESQUE SHOTS OF THE CAPE ANN KILLER’S WORK Davey tracks the killer’s activities across MONTHS, YEARS PLOP! A MAGAZINE SPREAD drops in front of his face. A PAI BARE AFRICAN TRIBAL BREASTS close enough to motorboat.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: BOOM! Afri-CANS... Get it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You guys aren’t gonna believe the shit I found -- Davey turns to find Eats and Woody. A stack of NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC magazines in their hands, AKA the best source porn a fourteen year old can easily get his hands on.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Forget what you found -- We snagged enough tribal muff to carpet your house. We’re back in business. Eats stuffs a pair of NatGeos down the front of his pants

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The hell are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Free porn, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in black, Davey and the guys shoot the shit with usual crew of MANHUNT KIDS as the last of the sun sets --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Okay, where the hell’s Sammy? We need him or we don’t have numbers.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBORHOOD KID 1
dialogues.text: I dunno. We haven’t heard from him in a few days. By the look on everyone’s faces, that’s not normal.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Are they home?  25.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBORHOOD KID 2
dialogues.text: Car’s in the driveway. They must be.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Let’s go get the little shit. Woody, stay here, make sure none of these dickweeds leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK -- Davey, Eats and Farraday await a response... that doesn’t come. Eats and Farraday peek int the windows beside the door...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: No movement.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Or lights. Oh well...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Oh well? You don't think this is a little weird? No one's seen Sammy in days. What if --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Don't even say it! They're probably up at the lake or some shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Then why's their car here? Davey goes to the Hoffmans' nearby station wagon. Squints the windows... Nothing out of the ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Maybe they rented one...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Why would they --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Who cares? The real issue is that we don't have numbers because of the little prick, so now I can't play Manhunt. Whatever, I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go catch up on my summer reading. Fuckin homework. Later. Fun extinguished. Eats and Farraday head off...  26. But Davey lingers. He approaches the front door, peers in the darkened windows, morbid curiosity boiling over. He casually TRIES THE FRONT DOOR KNOB, but it's locked. Bumm Davey turns around. Takes in the view from the Hoffmans' An unobstructed view of Mackey's backyard. Hmm... INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY Davey puts the finishing touches on a PB&J. Grabs the jel reaches for the refrigerator door -- Sees a NOTE WRITTEN MARKER on the MAGNETIZED REFRIGERATOR WHITEBOARD: “DATE: 6/29 MESSAGE: Working late again. Get a pizza. Cal one of the neighbors in case of an emergency.” ON THE BOTTOM OF THE WHITEBOARD, a LIST of NAMES and PHON NUMBERS: “Farraday, Mackey, Woodworth, Eaton,” etc... Davey puts the jelly back in the fridge, grabs the milk. Pours himself a glass and places the CARTON on the counte Takes a glorious bite of the PB&J. Swigs the milk -- NEARLY CHOKES at the PICTURE ON THE BACK OF THE MILK CART “DUSTIN ‘DUSTY’ DEWITT - MISSING SINCE 6/2/84" IT’S THE RED-HEADED KID HE SAW AT MACKEY’S HOUSE! HOLY! S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flickering light of CANDLES on the table in the cente the space gives a slightly crazy gleam to the eyes of --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mackey's the Cape Ann Killer! He looks like a man possessed. A prolonged silence hangs between Eats, Farraday and Woody.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I knew we shouldn’t have taken you to the library. I blame myself.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I also blame Farraday.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I know it sounds kinda ridiculous --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Yeah, because it is. As soon as that news report came out, we all knew it was just a matter of time til you --  27. WHAM! Davey slaps the MILK CARTON onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Congrats, you’re getting your calcium, so what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, man, look -- Davey points at the picture of DUSTY DEWITT. The guys gra the carton. Take a closer look at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Who’s the missing ginger?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That’s the kid I saw in Mackey’s dining room a few weeks ago! When we were playing Manhunt!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: How sure are you it's him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Never been more sure of anything in my entire life.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: That’s a low bar. Plus, redheads all look the same.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: So true.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Did you tell your parents?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No way! They'd never believe me, and they'd ground me. I need proof. Guys, I was only like ten feet away! I saw him clear as day! That’s him! Eats and Farraday study the carton, considering this insa possibility.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Plus, what about the Hoffmans? Their lakehouse is only a couple hours north, but their car's still here? Something's definitely off. And they have a perfect view of Mackey's yard.  28.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So, what if one of the Hoffmans saw Mackey with Dusty in the yard --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: The missing ginger.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: -- Mackey found out somehow, and then killed them to get rid of the threat. Silence. Everyone thinking over the details...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Look, I'll admit this is all pretty weird, but that's kind of a stretch.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Eats, tell him what Kyle said.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Farraday, what the fuck --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What'd Kyle say? Does he know something?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Goddammit. Fine. He said Mackey comes into the hardware store every week and buys like fifty pounds of dirt. Says it’s for his garden --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: His garden!? Bullshit! Who uses fifty pounds of dirt a week in a backyard garden? He’s also got a room in his basement with a padlock on the door. He’s single and he lives alone. Why would he need that? Davey plops down the CAPE ANN CHRONICLE. Points at a sect on the front page beneath the “CAPE ANN KILLER” headline

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Still not convinced? (reading) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Suspect is likely a white male, late-30s to 40s, lives alone...”

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Dude, Mackey’s a cop. With a sick reputation --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That’s what’s genius about it! He knows police tactics. He could plant evidence to throw them off, or destroy it if they ever found anything bad. Who would suspect a cop? It’s the perfect cover. A sense of dread spreads around the table. He's got a poi

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Guys, if Mackey is what I think he is, we've gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah, we gotta call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Have you not been listening? We report anything to the cops, Mackey will find out. Then he could just destroy the evidence. Or walk over and silence us. Permanently.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Okay, Magnum, P.I. What’s your plan?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We have to find out the truth -- And be able to prove it. This is all circumstantial; we’ve gotta find real, hard evidence. Which means... Mischief in his eyes, Davey smiles big. It's infectious a smiles wipe across every face around the table. Even Eats

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Stakeout?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Search and destroy. Who’s with me?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I'll bring the snacks. Davey, you get the gear.  30.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: This is batshit crazy. I'm in. Exhilarated, Davey puts his hand out -- Woody's, Farraday and Eats' quickly SLAP down on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Operation Mack Attack starts now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS over an UPBEAT ‘80s SYNTH JAM -- OPERAT MACK ATTACK in full swing: -- Mackey tosses a DUFFEL BAG into his immaculate 1980 JE WAGONEER, drives off. HIDING IN THE BUSHES, DAVEY lowers binoculars, jots down the time... -- AT DUSK, Farraday hunkers down INSIDE HIS PARENTS’ PAR CAR as MACKEY’S WAGONEER rolls past heading into his driveway. Farraday jots down the time... -- IN HIS ROOM, Davey adds NOTES to a LARGE WHITEBOARD. T accumulated observations, laid out by day and time. It’s starting to fill up... -- ON HIS PAPER ROUTE, Davey chucks a NEWSPAPER. It lands a perfectly manicured lawn. WE SEE THE HEADLINE: “FEAR AC CAPE ANN REACHES FEVER PITCH.” -- DURING A MANHUNT GAME, Davey peeks in Mackey’s windows Finds Mackey doing laundry. Sensing something, Mackey loo out the window to find -- Nothing. Davey ducked just in t -- FROM HIS TREEHOUSE, Eats looks up from a porno mag to Mackey eating dinner. Boooorrrring. Eats jots down the ti goes back to his magazine, unfurling a centerfold. Yowza. -- ON THE WHITEBOARD in his room, Davey adds MORE NOTES t each day. Most days and times are filled in... -- ON HIS PAPER ROUTE, Davey pulls a NEWSPAPER from his b looks at the news headline: “FBI CONSULTED IN CAPE ANN KI INVESTIGATION.” -- Mackey wipes sweat as he digs in his GARDEN. ABOVE HIM HIDING IN A TREE, WOODY jots down a note... -- FROM HIS BEDROOM WINDOW, Davey watches Mackey drive of He turns his binoculars to check THE HOFFMAN HOUSE. Still one home. Davey jots down notes...  31. -- Davey finishes adding a note to the WHITEBOARD and ste back. It’s full of notes from the stakeout. A week in the life of Mackey, HIS ENTIRE SCHEDULE, in black and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOURTH OF JULY BANNERS strung from lifeguard towers float the wind above the crowded beach. Families play and swim the sand and surf beneath the golden sun. ON A LARGE BEACH BLANKET, Davey, Eats, Farraday and Woody huddled around a NOTEBOOK --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Okay, run down. He leaves his house every day at 8:24 with the same duffel bag. Contents unknown. Grabs the last day’s mail on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Returns home with the bag around 6:25. Goes into the house through the garage door and closes it behind him. Always closes it!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He gardens. A lot. Like, five days a week. Veggies. Probably.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: He has dinner alone every night at 7:00... ish. Then probably wanks it and cries himself to sleep. Loser. BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! Eats’ CASIO CALCULATOR WATCH goes off.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Bikini break! One minute! The guys turn as one to look across the sand and gawk at NIKKI, in a DNA-stirring bikini, tosses a football with a couple other GIRLFRIENDS and a few ripped SENIOR GUYS. Di

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: God I wish I was that bikini.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I should've worn baggier trunks... Davey watches Nikki. Longing. Smiles to himself.  32.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So amazing how, like, everyone loves her, ya know? The guys shoot Davey a disgusted look --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you saying...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, I just mean she’s got a lot to offer the world... BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! The Casio alarm shatters their daydream

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: If you're done being a bitch, can we get back to work, please? But DAVEY'S GAZE REMAINS ON NIKKI as she bounces to and f with the football. It’s pure heaven.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, we know his schedule now, so what do we do next? Nikki, as if sensing she’s being watched, looks over at Davey. She smiles. We melt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (inspired) Catch this fucker and become heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS POV: Davey’s parents pull out of the driveway, gussied up for a night out. As they drive off...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're clear... The binoculars scan... Find MACKEY’S HOUSE. NO LIGHTS ON.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: on all fronts. EXT. EATS’ HOUSE - SIDE YARD - CONTINUOUS A small tent, walls glowing with lantern light from insid makes the perfect stakeout spot. EXCEPT IT’S EMPTY. Becau all the action’s currently happening up in the --  33.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: + come on, no way. How can you say that? They’re fuckin teddy bears! You think a buncha Teddy Ruxpins could take down the Empire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVEY’S FULL WHITEBOARD now hangs next to a pinned up PLA page with a NAKED CHICK who looks an awful lot like Nikki Davey, decked out in his black “Manhunt” clothes, lowers binoculars as his parents’ car disappears. He turns to fi the rest of the gang, also dressed in black --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: They’re aliens, and highly intelligent! Look how fast that one learned to drive a speeder bike, then ditch it without being spotted.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Whatever, dude. They’re bears. Now if it was Gremlins, I’d buy it. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I gotta get my parents to take me to see that. Maybe go with Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Sure, then she can find out what happens if she gets your Mogwai wet. The guys all LAUGH as HEADLIGHTS sweep across the cul-de- They instantly pile into the large treehouse window. Dave whips his binoculars up to watch as -- BINOCULARS POV: Mackey’s Wagoneer pulls into his driveway Mackey gets out, looks around at the sleepy neighborhood. Does he sense he’s being watched?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: What the hell’s he doing? BINOCULARS POV: After a moment, Mackey walks toward his h -- but goes around the side of the garage to the backyard

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Davey, where’s he -- The SOUNDS OF HEAVY DRAGGING snap their attention back to BINOCULARS POV: Mackey emerges onto his driveway again, pulling his GARBAGE CANS behind him.  34. He takes them to the curb. Heads back inside. The garage closes behind him. A few of the lights in his house pop o IN THE TREEHOUSE, Davey lets out the breath he didn’t rea he was holding. Woody and Eats lower their binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Wait, was that it? Stakeout over?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Let’s break into his garage.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We can’t do that. He’s a cop.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Guys, this is a stakeout. We know his patterns now. So we just sit back, watch and wait to see if anything strange happens. Davey brings the binoculars back to his eyes -- BINOCULARS POV: Davey scans, lands on MACKEY’S GARBAGE CA

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Or if an opportunity presents itself.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: At least we got snacks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every bag of snacks is shredded, empty. NATIONAL GEOGRAPH magazines discarded like spent hookers. Farraday, alone, rolls a twenty-sided die on the floor. Consults a D&D Dun Master Guide. A few HEAVY THUMPS draw his gaze to the ROO

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Woody, you rolled a sixteen. Your elf is trapped in a teleportation maze. You coming back soon or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUAWKING walkie at his feet, Woody struggles under the weight of Eats on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: We're trying to scope Nikki’s tatas and you’re talking about an elf?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Can you see her or not?  35. Eats raises his binoculars. Now WE SEE he’s trying to pee over Davey’s roof to Nikki’s window. He needs to go --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Higher, ya bearded freak of nature.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You’re so much fatter than you look!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys! I can hear you down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, the only one still focused, lies with his binocula sticking out the flap of the tent. Trained on Mackey’s ho

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Davey, man. Maybe we should call it. What’re you even hoping to see? Suddenly, finally, THE LIGHTS IN MACKEY’S HOUSE GO OFF.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That. EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - DRIVEWAY - MOMENTS LATER Under cover of darkness, Davey runs across the street, crouches behind the garbage cans. He watches Mackey’s win cautiously. No lights appear. The other guys catch up to

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What the hell’re we doing!? Davey puts his hand on one of the garbage cans. Smirks.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: His fuckin trash? Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There could be evidence in here. Fingers or bloody rags or something. We find anything, we got him.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Do you guys know me at all? I am not digging through trash.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We're gonna get in trouble if we tear up his trash on the street.  36.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’ve had to clean our deck three times in the last two weeks because raccoons keep getting into ours. That’s all anyone’s gonna think. The guys look at each other, disgusted. But what the hell

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: If I find a used condom in here... I’m gonna be so jealous.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: TRASH covers the base of the driveway. The guys’ hands an clothes caked in grime, sludge and worse. Except for Farraday, who sits a safe distance back on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: How do you know you can’t get AIDS from trash?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Only way you're ever gettin AIDS...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, good one. Don’t call me tomorrow when you’re puking blood. Davey tosses another EMPTY BAG onto the ground. Frustrate

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it. Nothing. Maybe he doesn’t do the killings here?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He could have, like, a lair or something somewhere...?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: A lair? He’s Cobra Commander now? Farraday, still off to the side, spots Mackey’s MAILBOX. Opens it, looks inside to find --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What about his mail? Can tell a lot about someone by the magazines they’re subscribed to... Big smile on his face, he digs out a brand new PLAYBOY, s in its cellophane wrapper.  37.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Ask and you shall receive! Eats is all smiles as he snatches it, rips it open, tosse the cellophane into the garbage pile and pages through it

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Farraday’s right. We can check his mail every day and he’1l never suspect a thing. See what bills he gets, who’s sending him stuff... Eats tucks the Playboy into his waistband. Per the usual.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I’1l handle that responsibility. Of course he will. Davey checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s 10:30. We should get outta here before my parents come back and see us. We can try again tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Night one, no luck.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Well, a little bit of luck -- Eats pats the magazines tucked beneath his waistband, smi As he and Farraday peel off toward their respective homes

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey Davey? Is it cool if I sleep over tonight? Kinda don't wanna be home.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was gonna ask you to anyway. I'll make popcorn and we can watch "Close Encounters."

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Awesome. I'll go grab my stuff. Be over ina bit. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Davey’s sitting at his window, Hardy Boys book in hand. B his gaze is fixed on Mackey’s house. What’s happening in there? Is someone over there in the dark, crying, praying DING-DONG! Davey JUMPS at the SOUND OF THE DOORBELL. Fuck gives the clock an accusatory look. 11:47pm. It's about t  38. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Davey bolts down the stairs, grabs the front door and swi it open, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Dude, what took you so long? NIKKI. She doesn’t wait for him to pick his jaw up off th floor as she breezes past him into the house wearing a se cut-off tee and short-shorts.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Expecting somebody this late?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, just Woody -- My friend, I mean. Not, uh -- Nevermind.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Wow, I haven’t been over in awhile. Your mom moved everything.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Uh -- I guess. Like a year ago. Nikki continues into the kitchen, grabs a soda from the fridge like she lives here.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Your folks aren’t home?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nah, date night. Nikki smirks, CRACKS the soda and it sprays the air. She takes a long, luscious sip, her eyes never leaving Davey. wipes her wet lips and gives him an amused look --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Good. -- winks and walks confidently to the stairs. Heads up... HOLY. SHIT. Is this happening right now? He realizes he’s just standing there alone. Bolts after her -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Davey flies into the room to find Nikki, already at his s window, binoculars up to her eyes.  39.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Huh... Better view of my room than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen you naked! Instantly mortified, Davey blushes. Grabs the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Too bad. I’ve got a great body. What!? Nikki smirks and walks away from the window. Equal parts embarrassed and turned on, Davey starts straightening up, stashing toys and nerd paraphernalia un his bed, in the closet. Wherever he can. But Nikki’s focused elsewhere, her hands tracing along th peeling National Enquirer covers that wallpaper his room.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Wow... When I gave you that first National Enquirer, I never thought it’d lead to this. What was that one again...? The cult that was, like, brainwashing Elvis' daughter for his money, right? Davey points to the wall where the cover of that National Enquirer permanently rests above his bed. Nikki smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: We had so much fun. God, sucks how much things have changed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Things have changed, but good things. Like, we're old enough to hang out together now. Totally onto his clumsy attempt at being suave, she lets finger gently touch his hand. Clearly having fun making h squirm.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Too bad I'm leaving. Guess we better get it all in now. Her big eyes lock onto his, gleaming with mischievous int Every gasket in Davey's brain about to blow, he remembers

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How, uh -- how’re your parents?  40.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Let’s stick to yours. What time did you say they’d be home? Uhhhhh... Mind. Frozen. She moves closer to Davey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! They HEAR the DOOR OPEN AND CLOSE DOWNSTAIRS!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Davey! We’re back!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck me. Nikki LAUGHS OUT LOUD at his reaction, slaps a hand over mouth. They share a look of excited amusement, then she rushes to the window. Climbs out using the roof of the ga to get down to the ground safely. Davey watches her go. Totally in love. Then leaps onto hi bed, drapes his comforter over his lap as -- HIS DOOR OPENS and his parents come in.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Honey? I thought I heard -- She sees her son, lap covered, disheveled, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: OH! Oh my God. Oh -- I -- I should have knocked --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nonononono! It’s not --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Jesus, Davey. The bathroom at least has a lock. They retreat from his bedroom, shut the door --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (yelling out to them) I wasn’t doing that! He hurries to the window -- Down below, THERE’S NIKKI loo up at him. She smiles, BLOWS HIM A KISS, heads off...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Davey, I think it’s time you and I had a little talk. When you're done.  41. Off Davey’s mortified face we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pall of fog hangs over the street as BOBBY COKER (15), pimply teen, exits the front door of a single story ranch home. As the screen door closes, he looks back and waves

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Thanks again for everything, Mrs. S!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anytime. Call when you get home so we know you're safe, okay?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY'S FRIEND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom, he lives like four blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's cool. I will. See ya. Bobby heads down the front steps and down the sidewalk. A turns the corner and out of sight --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY'S FRIEND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh crap, he forgot his bag. The screen door on the ranch home bursts back open and BOBBY'S FRIEND (15) flies out, hustles to catch up. He hurries around the corner to find --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: Bobby, you forgot your -- AN EMPTY SIDEWALK. Through the fog, he can just make out set of brake lights far down the block, as they turn and disappear into the void... INT. WOODY’S HOUSE - MORNING The flicker of the TV illuminates the room, glinting off empty cans and random refuse piled high on every surface. It’s the home of a boy without parents. Unless you count BRENDA WOODWORTH (50s) lies passed out on the couch, stil her nurse’s uniform. Makeup smeared across her face. Hair mess. The coffee table in front of her dotted with LITTLE WHITE PILLS carelessly poured out beside a BOTTLE OF GIN. Woody stands in the doorway looking at his parent. His security. And he knows he’s on his own.  42. He walks over, not needing to be stealthy. Digs a hand in purse. Comes out with her CAR KEYS. Gives Brenda one last troubled look. Pulls a blanket over her, kisses her foreh

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Love you, mom... Then heads out. Brenda doesn’t even stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackey, driving his POLICE CRUISER, rolls down the drivew Turns onto the street, passing --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Eight A.M. Right on time. A PARKED STATION WAGON. The guys are inside, ducked down, peeking through the windows. Woody, however, sits upright the driver’s seat, his troubled mind elsewhere --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get down, shit-for-brains! Woody ducks just in time as Mackey’s car heads past, crui down the street and out of sight...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Woody, what’re you doing? You’re gonna lose him already --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Guys, I’m freaking out right now, okay? I get caught driving my mom’s car and I’m dead shit!

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: You said she's sleeping off a 36-hour shift. She's gonna be out for hours --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: And you look like you’re thirty. It’s gonna be fine, now drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackey, in uniform, strolls along the sidewalk -- Says “Hello” to a PASSERBY as he enters the hardware store. ACROSS THE STREET, the guys pull up in the station wagon, ducked down but watching like hawks.  43.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Woody, what happened to you last night? Thought you were coming over.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Sorry. My mom... needed my help.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You'll never guess who showed up at my door instead. At midnight. Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No way! Really!?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, Davey.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Lemme speak in your language: There isn’t even a parallel universe with buttfucking Wookiees where Nikki came over to your house last night.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'm serious! She was about to kiss me when my parents got home and -- (eyes going wide) Guys, Mackey’s coming out! Davey points ACROSS THE STREET to where Mackey exits the hardware store...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: We're picking up this convo later. Eats’ brother Kyle is behind Mackey pushing a cart stacke high with LARGE BAGS OF SOIL.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, that is a lot of dirt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Just like Kyle said. How many bodies you think that would bury? Just then, another hardware store EMPLOYEE comes out push another cart. On it are six LARGE, RED-STRIPED BAGS of so sort of CHEMICAL, along with TWO SHOVELS and --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Is that a fuckin pick axe? Yup. Kyle and the other employee pile the dirt and suppli into the backseat and trunk of the police cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We gotta keep following him, find out what he’s doing with that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching a busy intersection, Woody and the guys have fallen a few cars behind Mackey.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You drive like my mom, dude -- You're gonna lose him! They're forced to stop at the red light and watch as Mack turns right on red. But the cars between them aren’t turn They just stop, boxing the boys in. Mackey's gone...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Woody...! The hell, man!?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: All right, frig this! You guys are dicks! I'm never doing this again!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Guys! Relax! Let’s just get home as fast as we can and hope that's where he's going too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys cruise along in silence, bad vibes in the air BWOOP-BWOOP! Woody looks into his rearview to find -- POLICE LIGHTS FLASHING! The guys turn to see a POLICE CRU bearing down on them as Woody pulls his mom’s station wag to the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Fuck! I’m so screwed!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Is that Mackey!?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Woody, just be cool --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I don’t have a license, genius!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Tell him you forgot it at home.  45.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What if it’s fuckin Mackey!? The COP gets out of his cruiser. As he approaches, the gu CAN’T SEE HIS FACE through the station wagon’s dirty wind GA-GLUNK -- GA-GLUNK -- DAVEY’S HEART POUNDS AS -- The cop TAPS on the window. Woody rolls it down revealing OFFICER COLE (40s), tall and serious, but definitely --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Not him... Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Officer Cole...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Dale. I thought that was you. Does your mother know you stole her car?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I just borrowed it! We wanted snacks and my mom was asleep --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: What if it wasn’t me that pulled ya over? You could be in real trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I know, and I’m wicked sorry. I’1l never do it again --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Got me in a real bind here. Can’t just bust ya cuz then how am I gonna look your mother in the eye at church on Sunday? Officer Cole considers a moment. Looks inside the car at of the guys, all of whom are terrified... Except Eats.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Mr. Eaton. What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Officer Cole. We meet again.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Look, guys, I get it. I took my Ma’s car out for a joyride now and then when I was your age. But times have changed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER COLE (CONT’D) Promise me you'll go straight home and never do this again --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Officer? Cole leans down, peers in at Davey to get a good look.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Do you know Officer Mackey? The other boys shoot Davey a look of death: Shut up, dude

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Town this small, everyone knows everyone on the force. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You like him? I mean, he a good guy?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: What’s this, twenty questions? Just go home. Where it’s safe. (lowers his voice) Another kid's gone missing. Everyone up at Town Hall's panicked. They're even canceling the block party. It's gonna be on the news any minute.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER COLE
dialogues.text: Get your asses home. And stay there. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT ON THE TV, Sheriff Caldwell speaks at an emergency press conference, addressing a crowd of REPORTERS. Behind Caldw a LARGE PICTURE of a smiling BOBBY COKER sits on an easel

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: The first 48 hours are vital. If anyone has any information, please call the hotline. Both on the edges of their seats, Davey watches next to h father as his WALKIE TALKIE SCREECHES TO LIFE --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Still can't believe this. Ya know they canceled block party, too? It's never been canceled before. What the hell is happening to this town?  47.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The eagle has landed! I repeat, the eagle has landed! Davey bolts up, sprints for the stairs and up into his --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Hey, clean your room while you’re up there...! Ya hear me...? INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Davey shuts the door, grabs his binoculars and peers out picture window -- BINOCULARS POV: In Mackey’s driveway, the brakelights of Mackey’s Wagoneer cast a creepy red glow over his yard. Davey quickly scans the back of the Wagoneer where the ba of soil should be... BUT THEY’RE NOT THERE.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys, the dirt’s not there.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s still in his cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Why would he leave it in there?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Or he stashes it someplace.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shit this guy’s good. The brakelights fall dark. Mackey hops out. Enters his ho Davey considers... WHISPERS to himself --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We’re on to you, Mackey... CLICK... CLACK... What the...? Davey turns to the side wi as a PEBBLE RICOCHETS OFF. He goes over, looks out to fin NIKKI. Gazing up at him. She waves for him to come out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Best summer ever...  48. EXT. NIKKI’S HOUSE - ROOFTOP - NIGHT Pair of stolen beers between them, Davey sits next to Nik listening expectantly. The moonlight is magical, it’s sum and Davey’s in love, even though --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I thought everything was fine. Then they just sat me down and told me they don’t love each other anymore. Like “that’s that.” They didn’t even seem upset. So fucked up...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: They still love you though. Nothing’s gonna change that.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: It’s like my life’s just been one big lie. I feel like everyone’s gonna judge me now. Like I can’t even talk about it with anyone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What about your friends?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Especially my friends. Their parents are all still happily married. Whatever that means. Davey nods, unsure what to say in the face of such traged

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Honestly, I can’t wait to get out of this stupid town, away from them. Davey tries to hide the fact that he’s crushed. Until he tears forming in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Are your parents happy?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I dunno... I guess...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You must think I’m a loser, bringing you out here for this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No way. I love hanging out with you - - I mean, ya know, as friends.  49. Nikki looks at him. Realizing for the first time --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You really care about me, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. I always have. They hold each other’s gaze for a long moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can I tell you a secret...? Nikki gives him an expectant look over her beer as she ta a swig. He musters his courage...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I think Mackey’s the Cape Ann Killer. Nikki nearly spits out her beer. Davey’s words seem to ju hang there in the air between them. Then Nikki CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Mr. Mackey? Davey, he’s friends with my dad. He’s totally harmless.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That’s what he wants you to think.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I know how your mind works. But you’re wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This is different. We’ve been spying on him and --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: He’s a cop! If your mom and dad found out you’re spying on him, they would flip their shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I know. That’s why they’re not gonna. Not until we have real evidence to show them.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Davey, listen to me. You gotta stop.  50.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’re just like everyone else...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: No, look -- If you’re wrong, you'll look like a lunatic and be in trouble forever. And if you’re right... he might catch you, or come after you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna get caught.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Please, just let the police handle the killer. I don’t want anything bad to happen to you... You might just be the only person left in this neighborhood I actually care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look through a few brand new porn mags, all addressed to Mackey. This is Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It’s the freakin mother lode.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Staking out Mackey was the best idea you've ever had, Davey.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Had a pretty good idea, myself -- Farraday pulls out a BOTTLE OF JACK DANIELS.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Snagged it from my dad’s stash.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: So you’re using those brainpowers for good. About damn time. Gimme some -- They eagerly pass the bottle around and take swigs. One b one, they cringe in disgust and GROAN. Farraday COUGHS --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s bad. It’s so bad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Tastes like my mouth is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Guess you dickheads aren’t men yet.  51. Eats keeps the Jack, clearly forcing it down with each ti sip as the other guys spit and swish sodas like mouthwash

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: So let’s hear it, what's up with you and Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We hung out again last night. She says she likes talking to me. We have, like, a connection.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Fuck you, a “connection.” Only connection I want with her is vaginal. Oral if she’s into it --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Don’t talk about her like that! The guys all blankly stare at him -- Who are you? Davey refocuses on Mackey’s house, miffed.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Ya think she douches?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Eww, Jesus, Woody!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What? My mom does --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Guys, we need to stay focused. Mackey’s still out there. We need something solid. Davey grabs the binoculars -- BINOCULARS POV: Davey scans the neighborhood, panning fro left to right...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: We’ve been on him for weeks. If he was gonna give us a clue, we’d have seen it by now, don’t ya think? lands on THE HOFFMANS’ HOUSE. Lowers the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Not if we missed it the first time. Grab the flashlight.  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys approach the front door. Everything dark inside. Davey shines his DURABEAM FLASHLIGHT through the windows can't make out anything. He tries the doorknob -- ERRRRRK -- AND IT OPENS! The front door slowly sways wide revealing a pitch black house. Davey’s eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What. Everyone keeps their door unlocked around here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this was locked last time... We gotta go in. What if they're dead in there?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You said the killer kills kids, not adults.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That’s not totally true. One of the articles at the library said he killed a whole family in Rockport. Police said something must've gone wrong. And if it's Mackey...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Fuck! That! You wanna go in there, be my guest. Dumbasses first. But Davey’s already on his way inside...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Davey, I was kidding! .... Davey! As they hesitantly follow Davey inside --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Guys, I got a bad feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farraday and Woody hang onto each other as the guys creep into the dark front room. Davey, flashlight leading the w finds the closest light switch. Flips it: nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Light’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You guys smell that?  53.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Smells like... roadkill.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: If it's a bunch of dead bodies, I'm totally gonna shit my Calvin Kleins. Davey redirects the flashlight toward the room revealing THE PLACE IS A MESS. An overturned chair in the living ro two open trash bags in the kitchen, flies swarming -- A C eating among the refuse; mail and other debris on the flo throughout. It looks like some shit went down!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
