dialogues.text: Still think I'm crazy? BRRRING -- The HOME TELEPHONE RINGS, scaring the hell out the boys.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Goddamit!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Farraday, check your Calvins. AS THE PHONE CONTINUES TO RING, Davey pushes ahead, movin through the dark, nervous as hell, the boys huddled behin him. Step by painstaking step... Davey aims the flashlight into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Woody, try the kitchen light. It's around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Me!? Why me!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Just do it! I'll shine the light. Woody falters, but forces himself toward the now-illumina kitchen doorway, rounds it -- AND BUMPS INTO SOMEONE STANDING THERE HOLDING A KNIFE! Wo falls backward onto the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FIGURE FLIPS ON THE KITCHEN LIGHT revealing -- IT’S NIKKI. And it’s not a knife she’s got, it’s a SCREWDRIVER. Thank Christ...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: What the fuck, fuckers! Nearly had a goddamn heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You guys scared the shit outta me!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We scared you!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What are you even doing here? With the lights off?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: A fuse blew while I was vacuuming this mess. Stupid cats.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Why’re you cleaning up after the Hoffmans’ cats? And where’re the Hoffmans?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: They're at the lakehouse for the summer. They pay me to make sure Barnaby and Trixy don’t die. Easy money. Usually... The guys share a look of relief tinged with disappointmen

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Wanna explain what the hell you guys are doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Sammy’s been missing so we thought maybe... the Hoffmans were dead.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: And that it might’ve been Mackey...? Seriously...? Nikki CHUCKLES. Davey looks away, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You told her? Okay, what is going on with you two? You hookin up?  55. Davey gives him a piercing, horrified look. But Nikki smi totally seeing what’s going on. She switches on the sexy.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Let’s just say he’s more of a man than you jerkoffs. She winks at Davey and heads off into the kitchen. Davey’s eyes couldn’t be wider. He’s in shock. The other LAUGH and HOLLER, proudly clapping him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit. You’re my God. JUST INSIDE THE KITCHEN, Nikki smiles wide, hearing it al INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - DAY Davey crashes into his room with a basket full of clothes

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: and don’t forget to clean your room! I mean it --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I know, Mom. God... Knocks a FRAMED PHOTO off of his nightstand. Picks it up It’s a PHOTO of DAVEY (10) WITH HIS YOUNGER MOM AND DAD. places it back on the nightstand as he dumps the clothes his bed. Looks around the room at the MESS. Ugh... He opens his disaster of a closet, jams more junk inside. he's about to close it, his eyes fall on -- TWO WORN GAMBLES G.I. JOE WALKIE-TALKIES atop a crate of toys. Davey’s wheels start spinning. He grabs his regular

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys, what time’re we playing Manhunt tonight? I’ve got an idea... EXT. MACKEY’S YARD - NIGHT Dressed in black, the guys sprint through backyards, unde porches, over driveways, converging in the bushes along Mackey’s house. They’re all out of breath, but exhilarate

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Arright, here’s the plan -- Davey pulls out the pair of old school G.I. Joe walkies.  56.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, you still have those?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: While you guys are spying, I’m gonna plant one of these outside Mackey’s window. Use the other one to listen.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Audio surveillance. Smart.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Let’s just not get caught, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mackey spots you, act like it’s part of the game. We probably got five minutes til those little shits are up our asses with flashlights, so let’s be quick. Farraday, Woody, you guys take ground level. Me and Eats are up top. Operation Manhunt starts now. They break. Eats follows Farraday. Woody follows Davey... -- Farraday runs into the bushes along the driveway. His pops up to LOOK INTO THE KITCHEN WINDOW as -- -- Eats climbs a tree to get eyes on the UPSTAIRS BATHROO Looks down at Farraday. Thumbs up. Then flips him off. -- Woody sneaks along the house to THE DINING ROOM WINDOW Where Davey saw the missing boy weeks ago. Looks up at -- -- Davey scales the tree at the front corner of the house over the driveway. Finds a VIEW INTO MACKEY’S BEDROOM. Gazing into the window, Davey makes sure Mackey’s not the Whips out the G.I. Joe walkie, some duct tape. Wraps the around the walkie SO THAT THE TRANSMIT BUTTON IS PERMANEN PRESSED DOWN (i.e. ALWAYS LISTENING). Davey slides himself out along a thick branch that reache toward the bedroom window. Manages to PLACE IT ON THE WINDOWSILL just outside the bedroom. CLICKS IT ON --

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Found ya, ya big, bearded ball sack! A BRIGHT LIGHT suddenly nails Woody below. He holds a han his eyes, looks into TOMMY WARRENS’ (9) flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Tommy! We got time out!  57.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: No, ya don’t -- I caught you!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Want me to beat the shit outta ya? Cuz I will, ya little -- AHHH! Tommy runs off into the night, terrified. Just then

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I got eyes on him! IN THE TREE AROUND THE HOUSE, Eats hugs the branches to h as THROUGH THE WINDOW, he sees -- MACKEY, YELLOW RUBBER GLOVES on both hands. He gathers CLEANING SUPPLIES into a BUCKET. He seems perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: He’s wearing rubber gloves! And he’s got a bucket of cleaning shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Like, stuff to clean up blood? Mackey heads out of the bathroom with his cleaning kit.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys, I lost him. He’s on the move. IN THE BUSHES BELOW, Farraday sees Mackey enter the kitch

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Got him! He just came downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s in the bucket?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Looks like bleach. And a scrubbing brush. Can’t tell what the rest is. What the...? Farraday spots a RED STAIN on Mackey’s shirt

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Blood! He’s got blood on him!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy crap -- Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Well, maybe it’s paint? I don’t know. It’s on his shirt -- Oh shit!  58. FARRADAY DROPS into the bushes as MACKEY WALKS RIGHT PAST window. When Farraday sneaks a peek again... MACKEY’S GON ON THE DRIVEWAY SIDE, Mackey comes into Woody’s view --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: I got him! Woody watches, face as close to the glass as he can get without fogging it up as Mackey pauses at the BASEMENT DO Checks his bucket. Pissed, he rushes down the steps...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: He went into the basement! Woody bolts to the nearest basement window. Crouches down look in but IT’S BLACKED OUT. PAINTED ON THE INSIDE. He rushes to the next window. Same. Next window... Same. Shi

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Mackey’s M.I.A. All his basement windows are painted over. DAVEY DROPS TO THE GROUND, looks up at the bedroom window THE WALKIE IS HIDDEN by the sill except the tip of the antenna. No way you’d see it. Unless you were looking for Satisfied, Davey sneaks up to the nearest window. Raises himself up to look inside just as -- MACKEY POPS INTO THE WINDOW! Slides it open to get fresh not noticing Davey, until -- DAVEY PANICS! SCREAMS, sprints away, Woody right behind h From the far side of the house, Eats and Farraday sprint from the shadows following Davey and Woody. Mackey stares out at them, concerned... INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT In bed but wide awake, Davey has the other G.I. JOE WALKI his chest. He shakes it a few times, but nothing changes. Total radio silence. He grabs his binoculars, looks out a BINOCULARS POV: Mackey's house. The tree beside it blocks Davey’s view of the G.I. Joe walkie on the bedroom windowsill. Damn.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The G.I. Joe walkie’s not working.  59. He looks back at Woody who's lounging on the floor in his sleeping bag, reading a comic by flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Did ya test em first?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, the batteries are brand new.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, the distance. Remember? Those things were junk, that’s why we upgraded. They couldn’t transmit far.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shit -- I forgot. Woody hops up onto Davey's bed, grabs the binoculars and gazes out toward Mackey's house.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: So what’re ya gonna do? Just say frig it and leave it up there?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No way. Who knows what we could find out. I gotta make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey wheels down the sidewalk on his bike, chucking newspapers onto porches. As he reaches Mackey’s driveway, slows to a stop. Waits -- No movement inside the house. Coast seemingly clear, Davey drops his bike and newspaper bag, hurries up the driveway... At the side of the house, he reaches down and SWITCHES ON G.I. JOE WALKIE clipped to his belt. NOTHING TRANSMITTING He goes to the tree below the window, gets ready to climb when he looks in the backyard and sees -- MACKEY, covered in sweat, dumping a big bag of dirt OVER HUMAN-SIZED MOUND IN THE GARDEN. Davey freezes in disbelief as MACKEY LOOKS UP, SPOTS HIM

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Yo, Davey! Davey strains to keep himself from bolting as Mackey clap dirt off his hands, walks up to the fence. Leans on it.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Hey, bud -- Gotta tell ya, you scared the shit outta me last night. Had no idea you were in my bushes. Great hiding spot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Your yard’s full of em.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Guess you didn’t see me coming either, huh? One hell of a scream. Mackey LAUGHS. Davey fakes it. Fuckfuckfuckfuckfuck...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: So what’s up? Oh -- Lemme guess, I owe you money?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Right. This time I’m ready for ya. He pulls a $5 bill from his wallet. Holds it out to Davey Davey reluctantly walks toward him. AS HE NEARS THE HOUSE SCREECH! A HIGH-PITCHED SHRIEK fills the air -- WALKIE-TA FEEDBACK! Horrified, Davey scrambles to turn off the screaming walkie on his belt. Finds the POWER SWITCH. Fli it off. Immediately, the FEEDBACK STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Must’ve left it on. From the game last night.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Mind if I have a look at it? Davey cautiously hands the walkie over. Mackey gives it a quick once over. Hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: You know, if you ever want some real walkies, I have a few retired ones from the force just collecting dust inside. Why don't ya come in and I'll show ya. They pick up everything --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I can't. Right now. Gotta get back to my route. But thanks for the payment.  61. Davey swipes the $5 bill from Mackey’s hand. Hurries back his bike. As he loads up and pedals off, he looks back. Mackey hasn’t moved. Gives Davey a parting wave. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Davey tries to read his Hardy Boys book, but it’s impossi He grabs the G.I. JOE WALKIE, paces with it, glaring at t object that nearly got him caught. Unable to resist the u anymore, he grabs his binoculars -- BINOCULARS POV: Mackey’s house. The tree outside Mackey’s bedroom window is still blocking the view of the sill. Da PANS ACROSS the house. Finally lands on --

dialogues.speaker: DIFFERENT WINDOW
dialogues.text: Davey dives out of sight, heart in his throat, shaking --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shitshitshitshit... Cautiously, he picks up the binoculars again, kneels at t window. Gathering his courage, he looks out to find -- BINOCULARS POV: MACKEY’S GONE! And then Davey sees it -- THE INSIDE SILL OF THE WINDOW WHERE MACKEY JUST STOOD...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER G.I. JOE WALKIE, STILL WRAPPED IN DUCT TAPE
dialogues.text: He knows! Davey lowers the binoculars, hands shaking, fac frozen in horror -- DEEP BREATH... DEEP BREATH... What the fuck do I do!? Davey paces. Grabs his walkie --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys! Guys! You copy? .... Come in! (radio silence) I’m freaking out! Woody, you there!? Dead air. Davey chucks the walkie onto his bed. His eyes canvas the room with purpose, landing on -- THE LOUISVILLE SLUGGER BASEBALL BAT leaning in the corner grabs it. Pulls a chair to the window. Loops the binocula around his neck and props himself up on his elbows to kee overnight watch on Mackey's house. EYES WIDE, vigilant -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - MORNING BLINK... BLINK... Davey wakes. Still in the chair, still holding the baseball bat. Realizes it's morning. Jolts up Wipes his eyes quickly, scanning the room. He’s alive.  62. Purpose in his eyes, he checks his watch: 9:33am. Bolts t his nightstand, grabs his walkie. Pulls his notebook out the top drawer. Flips through pages until he lands on -- “MACKEY'’S DAILY SCHEDULE” Eyes pouring over the details, Davey hones in on one line -- “11PM: GOES FOR A JOG.”

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO WALKIE)
dialogues.text: Guys, we gotta talk. Treehouse in twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKEY. Dressed in Larry Bird short-shorts, high socks, sweatshirt and headband. Jogging, breathing hard. His fac coming in and out of shadow as streetlights pass by above He’s all alone, king of the abandoned late night streets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The friggin walkie was sitting in his window. He wanted me to see it.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh my god. He's onto us. I should've listened to my parents.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your parents? Who listens to their parents?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There's no way he knows why we're spying on him, but even if he does, he's not onto you, he's onto me. Which is why I need you guys now more than ever. As Mackey keeps jogging, in the distance behind him, TWO FIGURES on BMX BIKES pop out from behind bushes. Follow safely behind Mackey, sticking to the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mackey goes for a jog every night at eleven. Farraday and Woody, you’re gonna follow him tonight. Farraday and Woody duck behind trees and lampposts for co Keeping as quiet as possible as they track their quarry..

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where are you and Eats gonna be?  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are all in front of the whiteboard. A military strategy session led by --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yesterday on my route, I saw Mackey dumping dirt over something in his garden. Something the size of a body.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I don’t like where this is going... EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Davey and Eats rush up the driveway dressed in all black. SHOVELS in hand. Barely visible under the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: While you two follow Mackey, we’re gonna tear up his garden. See if we can find that body. Or bodies... They toss the shovels over the fence, vault it. Red rover red rover...

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What if Mackey catches us?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. If he starts heading back, Woody and Farraday will radio to let us know. Davey plants a HANDHELD CB RADIO in the dirt. Turns it on keeps the VOLUME LOW. He and Eats dig in with the shovels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys seem a little hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Okay, but what about the garden? He’s gonna notice it’s all dug up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Raccoons. Just like with the garbage in the street. They’re trying to get food. What’s in a garden?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Food! Eats punches his shoulder. Idiot.  64.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We just wait for him to leave. Stay in touch with our CBs the whole time. It’s foolproof. Let’s pin the tail on this donkey. Off Davey’s grin, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panting, the sweat-stained Mackey runs up to your typical outdoor self-storage facility. Rows and rows of units. He takes a key out of his sock, opens the wide metal roll door. Enters and lowers the door ALMOST TO THE GROUND... FROM AROUND THE CORNER, Farraday and Woody watch on, thei bikes on the ground. But from their perspective, they can see inside the storage unit.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: We’ve gotta get closer.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: How the hell’re we gonna do that without him seeing us? Woody turns back to find FARRADAY IS ALREADY GONE!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Farraday! Goddammit... SNEAKING ALONG THE UNITS, Woody catches up to Farraday wh moving as silently and quickly as possible. They finally get to the edge of Mackey’s unit, hearts pounding. Farraday looks at Woody. Puts a finger to his l Don’t make a sound! Woody snarls back: No shit! Farraday points to Woody’s eyes, then around the corner: a look. Woody angrily mouths, Why me? Farraday: DO IT! Annoyed and terrified, Woody leans down, peeks inside the unit. HE CAN ONLY SEE ALONG THE GROUND. The roll up gate blocking everything higher than a foot tall. ON THE FLOOR OF THE UNIT are a shitload of BAGS OF SOIL, or five SHOVELS, the PICKAX, and a stack of LARGE, STRIPE BAGS labeled “NaOH.”

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) “Noah"...?  65. Next to the bags is A CAR, only its tires visible --

dialogues.speaker: SCREECH
dialogues.text: The guys jump back into the shadows as Mackey hops into h YELLOW VOLKSWAGEN BUG. The car engine PUTTERS to a start. Mackey PULLS THE CAR OUT OF THE UNIT. Hops back out, SING

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: “Every step you take... Every move you make...” Mackey closes the unit door after him. Locks it...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: “Every word you say... Every game you play, I’ll be watching you...” jumps back into his VW Bug and ZIPS AWAY...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Was he talking to us?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What? No dude, that was The Police.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You heard the police!?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I pray for you sometimes... Farraday and Woody sprint back to their bikes. As they ra away, Farraday YELLS into his HANDHELD CB RADIO --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO CB RADIO)
dialogues.text: Guys, Mackey just got into a yellow Volkswagen Bug. We lost him. EXT. MACKEY’S BACKYARD - GARDEN - CONTINUOUS ON DAVEY’S CB RADIO, partially covered in dirt, VOLUME ST LOW. FARRADAY’S WORDS ARE BARELY AUDIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I repeat, we lost him. Do you copy? TEN FEET AWAY, the oblivious Davey and Eats are still excavating, soaked in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: This is a lost cause. There’s nothing here.  66.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We're just not digging deep enough. Their heavy breathing fills the air...

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You know Mackey had a shed back here? Davey turns. Sure enough, deep in Mackey’s backyard, naturally camouflaged by trees, IS A UTILITY SHED. EXT. MACKEY’S BACKYARD - UTILITY SHED - MOMENTS LATER Davey and Eats peek inside the windows with bulky Durabea flashlights, but the glare on the glass is blinding.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can’t see anything. On the shed door is a PADLOCK. Davey jiggles it. IT’S LOC

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I got this... Eats reaches into his pocket. Pulls out a keychain. On it a PAPERCLIP. He unbends the paperclip, sticks it into the padlock. Works it around skillfully for a moment -- CLICK -- The padlock releases. Eats nods arrogantly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How the hell’d you do that?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: I’m just good at working the hole. Eats removes the lock. Opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Dude, I’m serious.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Honestly, just jiggle it a bunch, work it around and it’1l pop open most of the time. Wicked easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys check every nook and cranny with their Durabeams tools, a lawn mower, a work bench... Usual shed stuff.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Well this whole night's been a waste of time.  67. But something catches Davey’s eyes. In the corner. He shi his light on it... and his eyes go wide!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Until now. Davey reaches out, grabs a SHREDDED GREEN TEE SHIRT that’ fallen underneath a workbench. Recognize the LOGO on it?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: It’s a shitty Atari shirt, so what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So, this is Dusty Dewitt’s shirt!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Who...? .... Oh, the ginger. Davey looks over the shirt, sees --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This is blood!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Fuck, dude. Heinous --

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing in here!? Davey and Eats nearly shit themselves as they spin to fin FARRADAY AND WOODY, laughing their balls off.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You two got a death wish!?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Us? What about you? We’ve been trying to call you on the CB for like twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Oh shit, we left it by the garden.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Mackey has a storage unit outside town. And he keeps a VW Bug in it. He drove off and we lost him --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: We have no clue where he’s going.  68.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Then we better get the hell outta here. Check out what we found... As Davey shows the guys the bloodied Atari shirt, we -- INT. FARRADAY’S HOUSE - A SHORT TIME LATER Eats picks through Farraday’s refrigerator while the othe guys chow down on PB&J sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Why’s he got all those bags of dirt in the storage unit?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Plus shovels and a pickax...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Same reason he’s got Dusty Dewitt’s shirt. He killed him and buried the body somewhere. Davey tosses the bloody, shredded shirt onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Dude...! My mom makes my mac n’ cheese right there... Farraday grabs a pair of TONGS out of a drawer, picks up nasty shirt and rests it atop the trash.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He also had a bunch of bags of... something. They had chemical warning signs on em, looked hazardous as hell. “Noah,” that’s what it said.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: “Noah”? What the hell’s that?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know? But it was spelled kinda weird. Woody grabs a notepad and a pen. Jots down a few chemical symbols and writes “NoAH." Slides it over to Farraday --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Classic Woody. This look right? Farraday crosses out “NoAH.” Writes down, “NaOH.”  69.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: No, what you wrote means nothing. What I wrote is the chemical formula for Sodium Hydroxide.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Congrats, Woody -- You’re retarded.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Shove it, Eats.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What the hell’s sodium hydroxide?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I know it isn’t useful in gardening. Pretty sure it’d be toxic to plants. Davey hurries to the bookcase full of ENCYCLOPEDIA BRITANNICAs and scans them. Finds volume “Q-T.” Pulls it flips through rapidly -- IN THE BOOK, Davey’s finger traces down the page landing “SODIUM HYDROXIDE." His eyes grow wider.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, you guys! As the guys gather around Davey, he reads aloud:

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: “Sodium Hydroxide breaks down the chemical bonds that keep flesh intact, turning organic tissue to liquid. It's frequently used to decompose roadkill dumped in landfills, as it prevents the growth of microorganisms, therefore neutralizing and immobilizing acidic components formed in the decomposition process. This will reduce the odor of decomposition.” Eats, Farraday and Woody listen in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This sicko’s using this stuff to cover up the smell from the dead bodies he’s dumping someplace! “Holy shit" looks all around.  70.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Got good news for ya, Woody. It’s time to tell my parents. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Out of breath, Davey and the guys unload on Davey’s visib distraught parents. Dusty Dewitt’s frozen face stares bac them from the EMPTY MILK CARTON that sits atop the coffee table beside the shredded BLOODSTAINED ATARI TEE SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mackey’s the Cape Ann Killer!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: David Aaron Armstrong! Lower your voice. People outside might hear.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Mackey’s a cop for Chrissakes! He’s also been our neighbor since before you were born --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Every serial killer is somebody's neighbor, Dad --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Regardless, a milk carton, a tee shirt and a storage unit don’t prove a goddamn thing!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: How could you all go along with this?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: We didn’t want to, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: We wouldn’t have if it didn’t make so much sense.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: After we followed him to that storage unit and saw --

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Jesus, you’ve been spying on him!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We had to! And the more we watch, the more the details stack up. He goes jogging at eleven at night. He buys tons of dirt every week. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He keeps a spare car in a storage unit. Why would he do that? There was nothing in his garden when we dug it up, but I’m positive that if --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You dug up his -- Goddammit, Davey! Randall can’t sit anymore. He gets up and paces. Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You are in deep, deep trouble! All of you! Vandalism, spying, stealing -- This is unacceptable!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We're trying to save people.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Worry about yourselves! We’re going over there right now and you’re going to apologize for all of this. Randall grabs the milk carton. Rams it against Davey’s ch

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: I’m putting an end to this nonsense right now. You better hope he doesn’t press charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randall marches across the cul-de-sac, the boys following like dead men walking. WHISPERING to each other.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Fuck, Davey! You know how much shit we're all gonna be in now?

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: What’re we even gonna say to him?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He’s probably gonna kill us --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shut up! Davey inconspicuously tucks the bloody shirt into his bac pocket as they reach --  72. EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - FRONT DOOR - CONTINUOUS Randall RINGS THE BELL. The guys all cower behind him as DOOR OPENS. Mackey freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Randall. Guys. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Hey, Wayne -- Uh, listen, the boys have something they need to tell you, and I wanna apologize in advance. Just know that Sheila and I are as outraged as you're about to be...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Jesus... Well I’m sure whatever it is, we can make things right. Randall and Mackey look back at Davey, waiting. Davey swe under the pressure of being this close to Mackey. He can’ find the words. Randall nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Uh, hey, Mr. Mackey -- We just wanted to say we’re sorry. We’re the ones who ripped up your garden. And your garbage.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Oh man, I just assumed it was raccoons. Why’d you do that? Davey hands Mackey the MILK CARTON. Mackey looks at it, confused. Randall shakes his head, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: A few weeks ago, I thought I saw that boy in your house. We were playing Manhunt and I was hiding in your bushes and...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: And...? Come on, out with it. Davey looks to his buddies for support, but their looks suggest he’s on his own. You got us into this...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I had this idea that you were, maybe... the Cape Ann Killer. Mackey stares at him a long, tense moment. The guys all r to run like hell. But then... Mackey LAUGHS.  73.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: The guys at the station are gonna roar when they hear this! Randall smiles, relieved. The guys all chuckle a bit, uncomfortable and unsure where this is going. Even Davey gives an embarrassed smile, though it doesn’t reach his e

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So, who was the kid that was here?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: That was my nephew, Jamie. He was helping me renovate my darkroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Thought ya didn’t have family nearby? And we found this in your shed -- Davey hands the Atari shirt from his back pocket to Macke

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: David!?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: You broke into my shed, too? Randall's blood boils, utterly embarrassed, as Mackey inspects the shirt. Sees the blood immediately.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Wayne, I’m so sorry. You don’t need to respond to that --

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: It's fine. We were hammering nails all day. He must’ve cut himself. Look, I can call him right now. Come on in, let’s just settle this --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: No, no. That’s not necessary. We just wanted you to know what happened and that the guys promise to fix anything they damaged, no matter how long it takes. Right?

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Well, I appreciate the apology. No hard feelings, honestly. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember being a boy in the summer. Hard to turn down an adventure.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You're a better man than me, Wayne. 74. Randall grabs Davey and pulls him away. The guys follow.. EXT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - FRONT PORCH - CONTINUOUS The guys try to avoid Randall’s seething gaze as he opens front door...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Tell your friends goodbye, then get in your room and don’t come out. The rest of you, go home. We’1l be calling your parents. and heads inside -- WHAM! -- SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Well, that was a fucking disaster.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This doesn't change anything.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Seriously? Davey, come on. I mean, is it possible he’s the killer? Maybe. But odds are still that it’s not him.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Your summer’s fucked, but we may get outta this with just garden duty. I’m not risking what little of the good life I got left...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Spying on him was cool, but let’s just move on already.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You guys, we just need a couple more pieces of real evidence --

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Give it up, dude! I’m outta here. Call me when you get a life... Eats crosses to his own yard without looking back. Davey looks imploringly at Farraday.  75.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: I wanted to believe it too. But what’s more likely? That we got caught up in the moment, or that a cop we’ve known all our lives is a serial killer? Farraday claps Davey on the shoulder, heads home.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Davey. I’11 radio you tonight. Woody walks off, leaving Davey alone on the porch. Davey glares across the street to Mackey’s, enraged. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT A PAPERCLIP jiggles in the keyhole of a PADLOCK. Davey bi his lip in concentration. Nothing. Jiggles some more. The CLICK! The lock opens. Davey smiles as --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Holy shit, it worked... BRRRING! The house phone RINGS. Davey bolts off his bed, into the hallway and answers --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can you come over? INT. NIKKI’S HOUSE - NIKKI’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Davey looks around, enthralled. HE’S IN A GIRL’S BEDROOM! not just any girl’s room -- NIKKI FUCKIN KASZUBA’S! Half-packed CARDBOARD BOXES fill the room. It’s a mess. N sits on the bed in the eye of the storm as Davey takes it

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Did I get you in trouble for calling so late? I was hoping your mom wouldn’t pick up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nah, they’re downtown at a meeting about how to handle the block party situation. Looks like you’re the one who could use some help, though. Nikki hands him something --  76.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey, check out what I found... Hands him a WORN PHOTO of the two of them together, back she had braces and he was still in grade school.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: It’s coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: To UConn? Really?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah... It’s going up on my wall. Davey swells with pride as an overwhelmed Nikki drinks in barely-recognizable room...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: God, feels like I’m packing up my whole life. I didn’t think I’d miss this place, but now... I can’t deal. Out of his depth, Davey sinks down to the bed beside her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Seriously? Aren’t you the one who says this town’s lame?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I don’t know what I feel anymore. Everyone keeps talking to me like I’m already gone and it’s wigging me out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s probably just cuz everyone’s gonna miss you. I know I will.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Wish my parents felt that way. They’re so wrapped up in the divorce, they don’t even care that I’m gonna be gone. I just feel so... alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’re not alone. He puts a supportive hand on her arm. There’s a smooth confidence to him that’s charming. Nikki can’t help smili

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You're sweet. Hope the students at uConn like me half as much as you.  77.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: They will. You’re destined for way more than living in this stupid neighborhood forever. I'd give anything to get outta here with you. Nikki reads Davey’s conflicted face like a National Enqui

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Okay, spill. (Davey feigns ignorance) I remember that look. Used to see it all the time. You're in trouble, huh? Davey considers... Finally comes out with it --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m grounded, big time. My parents are pissed. My Dad made me admit the whole thing to Mackey --

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What!? No he didn’t!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The guys bailed on me. Worst part is I know I’m right about him. Just don’t know what else I can do. Nikki takes his hand. He meets her concerned gaze.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Let it go. You only get the chance to be a kid once. Enjoy your life while you can. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: If I’m right, who’s gonna stop him? INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: WE HEAR FOOTSTEPS DESCENDING THE STAIRS, revealing -- Davey. He fixes his hair in the mirror beside the door, clearly hoping it’s Nikki. He opens the door to find -- MACKEY. In his police uniform. Oh shit! Davey immediately stands straighter. Glances at the GUN in Mackey’s holster

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Davey. What’s goin on?  Davey just His choice 78.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What’re you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: I wanted to make sure we’re good. I feel pretty bad about everything that happened yesterday. stares back at him, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Mind if I come in for a second so we can talk?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Now’s not a good time.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Cool. I get that... You know we’ve got everyone out looking for this sicko, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Then why haven’t you found him yet?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: These things take time. Sometimes years. If ya want, I can stop by and give you updates.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do that. I see the paper before anyone, remember?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: You sure? It’d be my pleasure. I know this stuff interests you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Was there anything else, Mr. Mackey?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Wow, you really don’t like me, huh? That really bums me out, Davey. Last thing I want is for there to be bad blood between us. of words sober Davey. He pauses... Softens...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. It’s just my summer’s basically destroyed now because of the whole garden thing. Pretty sure my parents hate me.  79.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Want me to talk to them? See if I can lighten the sentence? Happy to.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s all right. Thanks though.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: I just keep wondering what I did that made you so suspicious of me...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I dunno. My dad says I read too many mysteries. With the Killer on the loose, I just got caught up in it.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Hey, I get it. That’s why I became a cop. It’s exciting what’s going on, and you wanna help. That’s awesome. I’1l admit, the stuff you thought was proof looked pretty bad out of context. You’ve got the brain for this kinda work. Davey smiles. Finally lets down his guard.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Anything I can do to smooth things over once and for all?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yesterday you offered to call your nephew. Wanna maybe call him now?

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, absolutely. Kinda gotta come in to do that though.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Actually, our cord’s wicked long. Wait here a sec -- Davey hurries off into the -- KITCHEN. Back against the cupboards, Davey’s freaking the out. He slowly sneaks a peek around the corner to find -- Mackey’s taken one step into the house. Standing there looking as awkward as anyone would in this scenario. Davey leans back into the kitchen. Takes a few DEEP BREAT Spots the WOODBLOCK FULL OF KNIVES.  80. Plucks out the BUTCHER KNIFE and slides it carefully down back of his pants. Picks the kitchen phone off the jack, heads back into the -- LIVING ROOM. Hands Mackey the phone, cord dangling off in the kitchen. Mackey points into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Place looks great. Haven’t been here since -- Man, you were probably a toddler. I helped your dad haul a bunch of stuff into your attic.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Weird how times change, huh? Mackey DIALS. Puts the phone to his ear --

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: My sister lives in New Hampshire. (checks his watch) Hmm, they might not be home. Jamie’s big into baseball. Usually has practice around now, I think. He listens for a few more moments. Shakes his head. Holds the phone so Davey can hear the RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: I can come back if you want? Try him again later...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, it’s fine -- I’m sorry for being such an idiot. I promise we’ll fix your garden even better than it was. Mackey hands the phone back. Offers his hand to Davey.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: No hard feelings? Davey’s hand trembles slightly as he takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Sorry again you’re grounded. I’1l see what I can do about getting you out of the house, all right? Mackey heads off down Davey’s driveway and Davey shuts th door behind him. LOCKS IT. Peeks out to make sure Mackey’ leaving. Bolts --  81. BACK INTO THE KITCHEN. Rushes to the whiteboard on the fridge. Grabs the MARKER and DIALS “0” on the PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Operator. How may I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Can you tell me the last number dialed from my house?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The last number dialed from that residence was 508-356-0742. Davey writes the number on the whiteboard. HANGS UP, eyes wide. He quickly scans the list of EMERGENCY NUMBERS besi the whiteboard, finds what he's looking for --

dialogues.speaker: IT'S MACKEY'S PHONE NUMBER
dialogues.text: INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - LATER The guys are all here. Davey looks between them for some of reaction, other than disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How are you not freaking out right now!? He called himself! There is no Jamie! He tried to throw me off and I caught him. This proves he's guilty! We gotta get into that house to find out what’s in that basement --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Look how much trouble you're in just for digging up his garden --

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Davey! Get down here!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shit. Wait here. Don’t make a sound. He grabs his walkie. Clips it to his belt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: If I think my mom knows you’re up here, I’1l radio so you can climb out the window.  82. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Davey jumps down the stairs to find his mother Sheila standing before the television once more.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I want you to see this. ON THE TV is a LIVE PRESS CONFERENCE. Sheriff Caldwell is a podium filled with microphones.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: -- happy to report that we have the Cape Ann Killer in custody. A MUGSHOT of an average WHITE GUY (40s) pops onto the scr Beneath the photo: “JAMES VIGNERON - ‘THE CAPE ANN KILLER Davey’s jaw drops in disbelief as the PHONE RINGS. Sheila goes to answer it in the kitchen as Davey subtly reaches his walkie. Holds down the TRANSMIT BUTTON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guys are mid whisper argument when the WALKIE i Woody’s hand suddenly comes to life. They shut up --

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thanks to the fine effort of the Ipswich Police Department, we apprehended Mr. Vigneron earlier today. I’d like to bring up the arresting officer, Wayne Mackey.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Davey watches on in stunned silence as Sheila talks on th phone, hidden from view in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: I know this has been a trying No, I think it's perfect! time for our community. But +... In poor taste? No, this we hope this announcement is just what everyone needs will bring peace to those who to help lift their spirits. have been living in fear. +... Ok, be there in a few. Mackey looks at the camera, as though seeing Davey throug the airwaves. Davey stares back, unflinching.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY, (FROM TV)
dialogues.text: Justice will be served. Thank you.  83. Mackey waves and steps down as the CROWD APPLAUDS and She returns to stand at Davey's side.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: The block party's back on. And all because of Mr. Mackey. While the rest of us are celebrating, I want you to think about your actions. Because it turns out the man across the street isn't a killer, David, he's a hero. EXT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS A frustrated Davey stands before his incredulous buddies.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He’s not a hero! Did you guys not just hear that broadcast? Now we know he’s guilty!

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Are you retarded? He caught the killer! It can’t be him!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Don’t you think it’s a little coincidental that the guy we just accused of being the killer just so happens to then catch the killer? Farraday, you said it yourself -- Cape Ann’s wicked big, right? Farraday shrugs: Yeah, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This is exactly what we talked about -- He’s a cop, it’s the perfect cover. He can plant evidence to make someone else look guilty! If Mackey’s got these bodies, all he’d have to do is plant one in someone’s yard. Boom -- They’ve got a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Dude, you just sound desperate now. Just admit you were wrong and --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not wrong! I know there’s something behind that locked door! We have to find out what before some innocent guy takes the rap for Mackey and more people die!  84.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Even if you got in, how are you gonna get any evidence out? Can’t just drag a body out of a basement.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t have to. I’m gonna use my dad's camcorder, film it all. No need to steal evidence if I get it on tape. Tape doesn’t lie. Davey can see clearly the doubt etched on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I just need you guys to keep watch, and make sure Mackey doesn’t come home while I’m in there.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: No, I’m done with this shit. You’re gonna get caught, either by Mackey or your dad --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Everyone’s gonna be at the block party. All I need you to do is set up at the bus shelter down the street. Bring booze and pornos, whatever. Just radio me if Mackey’s car comes up. And Farraday --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: You know my parents make me go to the block party every year --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m counting on it. You can keep eyes on Mackey there. He leaves early, you give me the heads-up. We’1ll have multiple layers of protection. No way we get caught.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: “We”?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’re coming with me. I’11l owe you. The guys consider for a few moments. Then, finally --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: If it means we're gonna finish this... I guess I'm in.  85.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: Yeah... me too. One last shot.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Whatever, fine. But if anyone asks, I’m pinning the whole thing on you. Davey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Mackey’s crazy if he thinks he can do this shit on our block and get away with it. Time to make him pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the fading light, NEIGHBORHOOD FAMILIES walk together toward the DISTANT DIN of the downtown summer block party Among them, Farraday strolls with his parents, HANDHELD C RADIO clipped to his pants. He looks back at -- INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - ENTRYWAY - CONTINUOUS Looking totally bummed out, Davey’s slumped in a chair by TV as his parents open the front door to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This is so not fair!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: David, a punishment’s a punishment. If you really gave a damn about going to the block party, you wouldn’t have acted like a lunatic all summer --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Just lemme go and I’11 be grounded again after --

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Not happening! End of story! Randall heads out with Sheila. Once the door is shut -- Davey’s all business. He sprints up to his room, over to picture window. WATCHES the beehive of activity as his parents join the other neighbors heading to the block par FROM HIS DRIVEWAY, Mackey pulls out in his SQUAD CAR. Giv friendly BWOOP-BWOOP and flashes the lights for the CHEER NEIGHBORS as he rides past... Davey grabs the HANDHELD CB RADIO off the shelf --  86.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Guys, it’s “go” time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANNER hangs over the quaint downtown -- “75TH ANNUAL IPSWICH SUMMER BLOCK PARTY.” Below the banner, a bustling CROWD enjoys fried dough, strawberry shortcake and beer as a BEATLES COVER BAND pla “MAXWELL SILVER HAMMER” from a makeshift stage. IN THE CROWD, Farraday hangs back from his parents, eyes MACKEY, dressed in his police uniform. He’s beside a few other OFFICERS, laughing, greeting the swarming citizens thank him for catching the killer. A bonafide local hero. Farraday pulls out his CB radio --

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Got eyes on Mackey. You guys are good to go. Over...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. We’re moving. INT. EATS’ HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Lounging on his couch, Eats watches WHEEL OF FORTUNE with Kyle as ON TV, PAT SAJAK describes the usual prize packag CRASH! Glass SHATTERS against a wall in another room --

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You goddamn bitch!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Mark -- Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Janice! Hey! I’m talking to you! From the kitchen, their mother, JANICE (40s), darts into living room, seething hatred on her face. She grabs her c keys off the coffee table -- Eats watches on, clearly upset. Kyle on the other hand ke watching TV, like he’s seen this a million times. Janice heads for the front door, exits, as their father, (40s), bolts out after her --  87.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Where the hell you think you’re going? Janice! Get back here -- WHAM! The front door slams after them, Pat Sajak’s nasall voice filling the uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Eats! Eats! You in position? Eats grabs his HANDHELD CB off the couch beside him --

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. Wheel is on. Eats sullenly hops off the couch, grabs his backpack and heads out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: EATS, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Hey Dickholes, chill. I’m going now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under cover of dark, Davey and Woody hurry to Randall’s N VAN. Davey opens the trunk, pulls out the BETAMAX CAMCORD

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hold this. He hands the camcorder to Woody, grabs a BATTERY PACK, an EXTRA TAPE. Stuffs them in his backpack. And they bolt to Mackey's house, into his sideyard... UNKNOWN POV: From across the street, we watch Davey and W race around the side of Mackey's house toward -- EXT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - MOMENTS LATER In the pitch black, Davey holds the camcorder at his side while Woody removes a screen window. Places it on the gro

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I’1l give ya ten fingers. Woody squats down, interlocking his fingers. Davey wedges foot in Woody’s hands for a boost up and into -- INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Feet on the floor, Davey gets his bearings as Woody repla the screen window from outside.  88.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Kay, now let me in. Davey unlocks the back porch door. Woody enters, camcorde hand. The guys check out the place. There’s an unnatural stillness to it. Undeniably creepy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He’s definitely killed kids in here.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Why would you say that right now? Davey spots the basement door down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Cuz it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: UNKNOWN VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let's find out. AHHHHHHHHH! Davey and Woody spin to find -- NIKKI. Standing in the back porch doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What is it with you scaring us!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: After everything you've told me, I wanna see for myself.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Thought you said I should let it go.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, if you're right, who else is gonna stop him? She gives him a knowing wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farraday chows some fried dough beside his mom and dad wh inexplicably enthralled by the cheesy Beatles cover band

dialogues.speaker: FLASHING LIGHTS CAPTURE HIS ATTENTION --
dialogues.text: NEARBY, a CROWD has gathered, blocking whatever they’re looking at from Farraday’s view. The flashing lights are cameras as REPORTERS capture the moment for the local pap  89. Farraday moves closer to get a better view. As he splits through the crowd, he sees -- MACKEY and five other POLICE OFFICERS, SHOVELS IN HAND, camera-ready, gathered along a brand-new median strip. In strip are beautiful flowers, COVERED IN FRESH SOIL. A PIC leans against the centerpiece of the strip, a TREE. A SIGN sticking out of the dirt reads, “DOWNTOWN BEAUTIFICATION PROJECT - SPONSORED BY THE IPSWICH P.D.” Farraday nearly shits himself, face turning white as a gh INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT STAIRS - CONTINUOUS At the basement door, Davey stares at the knob. Trying to build up his courage. Woody and Nikki wait behind him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We don’t have to go down there... CLICK -- Davey turns the doorknob, slowly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I do. Woody GULPS. TURNS ON THE CAMCORDER as Davey flicks the l switch. NOTHING HAPPENS. The stairs remain pitch black.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh come on -- SQUAWK! The guys and Nikki nearly jump out of their skin

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Davey! Davey, you copy!? Realize it’s just the CB.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Is he on his way back!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an alley, away from the crowd, Farraday spies the beautification ceremony from afar, CB to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Way worse. You’re wrong about everything. The dirt and shovels were for a project Mackey was doing with the police department. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: They planted a shitload of flowers down here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: That doesn’t prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- It’s over. You’ve gotta learn when to walk away. School starts in a week and I only made it through half of what I was supposed to. My parents are up my ass. I gotta focus. I’m out, Davey.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (INTO CB)
dialogues.text: Farraday, wait -- CLICK. Farraday shuts off his CB, joins the fun.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s right. Maybe we should just go. This is crazy. We just broke into a friggin cop’s house!

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: We're already here. May as well take a look. If it's not him --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s him. And we’re about to find the proof. Davey takes his first step down into the darkness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive Cariole headphones over his ears, Eats sits on th shelter bench, tears in his eyes, listening to a punk son HEADLIGHTS wash over him and he perks up, freaked out. Wi his tears. Is it Mackey!? Grabs his CB RADIO... but the car rolls past. Relief. INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - CONTINUOUS As they make their way down the basement steps, scared shitless, the pitch blackness blends with a BLOOD RED GLO

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Tell me you brought a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The camcorder's got a light.  91.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: This thing has a light and you’re just telling me now!? Davey reaches over, clicks the camcorder’s light switch - ITS BEAM PIERCES THROUGH THE CRIMSON DARK, bright, focuse but THE PERIPHERY IS ABSOLUTE BLACK. TUNNEL VISION. Woody uses the light to scan the area. TO THEIR LEFT is Mackey’s dark room, red light emanating from within. TO T RIGHT, a washer and dryer. EVERY WINDOW IS PAINTED BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Creepiest basement ever -- WHACK! Woody hits his head on A DANGLING LIGHTBULB --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Jesus, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s just a light! Davey reaches up, pulls the chain -- POP! They jump back the bulb BURNS OUT, SHATTERING IN A BLINDING FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I can’t see! I can’t see --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Calm down. Just follow me. Woody puts his hand on Davey’s shoulder as they move to - THE PADLOCKED DOOR in the corner that captured Davey’s attention from the moment he saw it -- KACHUNK! Woody SCREAMS, whips the camcorder around to fin THE LARGE FURNACE, its metal GROANING.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Woody! Chill out, you girl!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I’m not built for this shit. Davey moves to the door. Pulls a PAPERCLIP out of his poc

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Shine the light right on the lock. Woody brings the light over. Davey straightens the paperc Sticks it into the keyhole. Jiggles it around --  92.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Seriously? Did Eats teach you that? Because it doesn’t work -- CLICK! THE PADLOCK RELEASES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eats hasn’t moved, still desolate, off in another world - SCREECH! Eats’ eyes burst open -- What the fuck was that! RIPS OFF HIS HEADPHONES, looks around, listens intently..

dialogues.speaker: THE ONLY SOUND IS THE TINNY MUSIC COMING FROM HIS HEADPHO
dialogues.text: A SUMMER BREEZE COURSES through the trees, questionable sounds all around. And then -- DEAFENING SILENCE envelops the area. Until --

dialogues.speaker: VAGINA
dialogues.text: AHHH! Eats jumps back, petrified, to find -- FARRADAY, laughing his ass off.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: You’re such a friggin dick! Eats gets up to pummel Farraday. Puts him in a headlock a

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Why’re you even here? You’re supposed to be watching Mackey.

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: My mom and dad wanted to leave. I ran ahead to fuck with you. I’m sorry. You can go home. Whole thing’s off.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Davey’s still in Mackey’s house -- MR. AND MRS. FARRADAY approach -- EH-EHM! CURTIS SR. Thomas. What on Earth are you doing at the school bus shelter this late? Eats releases his death grip. Straightens Farraday’s clot  93.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just showing Curtis here a few Karate Kid moves I’ve been practicing. Wax on, wax off... They don’t get the reference. Academic types. Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Hey, mind if I sleep over tonight? My parents are fighting again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Of course. Poor thing. They have no idea the damage they're doing to you. CURTIS SR. But Curtis, no fun until your reading’s done. Understood? Farraday nods, annoyed, as his parents head off...

dialogues.speaker: FARRADAY
dialogues.text: How bad is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: EATS
dialogues.text: Let’s just say I don’t wanna witness a murder-suicide... Eats grabs the handheld CB. TURNS IT OFF -- INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - MAKESHIFT BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS We finally get a good look at the place as Woody moves th light around. It’s a bedroom. A teenage boys’ room. Sport posters on the wall. A twin bed. Vintage radio on a dress

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What is this place? Davey touches the frayed ear of a stuffed bunny that sits a heap of old stuffed animals on a rocking chair. He lift the blanket on the bed. It’s raggedy, worn. Pillowcase to

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You think he keeps his victims down here or something? Davey inspects the AUTOGRAPH on a RED SOX TEAM POSTER...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: “To Wayne. Keep it up, Slugger.”  94. He finds the year on the poster -- 1956. Davey looks arou with new eyes, realizes why it all seems off. Everything’ frayed and yellowed under a sheen of mold and dust. It’s

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Holy shit. This stuff’s all his. Like from when he was a kid or something.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: But Mackey didn’t grow up here. My dad said he's from Maine.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He must've brought it all here.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You said there was gonna be proof, Davey -- Where is it? As the camcorder light moves around, SOMETHING CATCHES DAVEY’S EYE ON THE WALL BEHIND THEM --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wait, shine it back over there! Woody retraces his path. The light falls on -- A WALL OF PICTURES. They move closer to discover... THE

dialogues.speaker: PICTURES ARE OF THEM
dialogues.text: THE TENT, THE BUSHES, GOING THROUGH MACKEY’S TRASH, ON

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This enough proof for you?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He was watching us the whole time!?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Suburbia's so fucked up. THUD! Woody whips the light around as they all look at th far corner of the room. STRANGE NOISES come from behind a door they hadn't noticed. SHUFFLING... MUFFLED SOUNDS... Davey slowly approaches the door, grabs the knob. Looks b at Woody and Nikki. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Make sure you're filming. Woody nods, terrified. Davey yanks open the door revealin  95. A BATHROOM. Woody shines the camcorder light around at ey level. Mold stains the walls beneath peeling paint. Gross The light finally finds a bathtub, its CURTAIN CLOSED. FLIES BUZZ in the air -- Davey, Woody and Nikki swat at t as Davey inches toward the curtain, HEART POUNDING... Rea out... GA-GLUNK... Grabs it... Then RIPS OPEN the curtain A BURGUNDY SLUDGE fills the tub, a couple UNIDENTIFIABLE jutting slightly out of it.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What the heck is that? Davey grabs the plunger, pushes it into the sludge. Rotat whatever's in there, EXPOSING MORE OF IT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Gimme some more light. Woody focuses the camcorder’s light on the bits jutting o of the sludge, and WE IMMEDIATELY RECOGNIZE --

dialogues.speaker: THE PARTIALLY DECOMPOSED HAND AND FACE OF DUSTY DEWITT, T
dialogues.text: MISSING REDHEADED BOY!!! !!!ii!ribbrriet

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s fuckin Dusty Dewitt!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh god... oh my god... AHHHHHH! NIKKI LETS OUT A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM! Woody follows her gaze, aiming the camcorder at the floor where A PAIR OF HANDS ARE WRAPPED AROUND NIKKI'S ANKLE! The lig reveals duct-taped wrists, moves up the emaciated arms to find the battered face of BOBBY COKER! One ankle chained radiator.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Get him off me! Get him off! Davey drops to his knees, wrenching Bobby's hands from Ni But Bobby grabs Davey's collar, yanking Davey's face just inches from his own as he SCREAMS around the gag --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MACKEY’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Davey and Woody burst out of the basement, holding up Bob between them. Nikki follows, camcorder on her shoulder filming it all. As they bolt through the living room -- CRASH! Davey knocks a PICTURE off an end table. He looks at it, FACES VISIBLE IN THE MOONLIGHT. Something register Davey stops to pick it up, realization in his eyes -- Woody struggles to hold up Bobby on his own --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Davey, let’s go! .... Davey! IN THE PICTURE, a smiling BLOND BOY (15) -- FLASH! MICROFICHE, FROM DAVEY’S TRIP TO THE LIBRARY. Fron page of the newspaper. THE SAME BLOND BOY, SMILING. MISSI Frantic, Davey scans all the FRAMED PHOTOS on the end tab and hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Davey, we gotta get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A PHOTO OF A SHAGGY BOY (14) in his class photo -- FLASH! MICROFICHE OF THE SHAGGY BOY, MISSING...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: These are his trophies...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: The people in these pictures aren’t his family. They’re his victims... Davey looks across the room at all the frames. They COVER ENTIRE WALL. And then he sees --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: And I’m next...  97. He gulps down the panic. Pulls the photo from the wall. S Woody and Nikki -- Pure horror washes over their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of COPS have the same looks of horror as they w the Betamax tape in stunned silence. Standing among them, Brenda Woodworth, in her nurse’s uniform, flanked by Rand and Sheila holding her hands in support. THROUGH THE CONFERENCE ROOM WINDOWS, Davey watches Bobby Coker wrapped in a blanket, his PARENTS holding him and crying. A family reunited. Because of him. As the tape ends, Sheriff Caldwell looks at Davey and Woo across the table.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL
dialogues.text: You found all this in his house?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: And there's pictures of dead people all over the fuckin walls! Caldwell stands, addresses the gathering of cops.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL
dialogues.text: Somebody get out to Mackey’s. And bring that sick son of a bitch to me. (to the parents) You folks mind sticking around to give a report? Only take a while. Randall and Sheila nod approval as the cops scatter ina rush. Before heading out, Caldwell turns back.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CALDWELL
dialogues.text: You two must be proud. These boys are heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping outside, Davey takes a deep breath of fresh, coo night air. He looks back through the glass doors to see a the parents talking with Sheriff Caldwell. From inside, Nikki sees him, breaks away from her parents jogs out to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey. You okay?  98.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Is it me or does none of this feel real?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You're telling me. I just saw my parents hug each other for the first time in... awhile. So yeah...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wow, that's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Not gonna get my hopes up but... That happened because of you. So thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I dunno about that. I mean -- Nikki seizes the moment -- AND KISSES HIM. Davey's eyes g wide, then close. He's in Heaven. Like, whoa. When Nikki pulls away, Davey's eyes stay closed.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: See ya, Davey. Heading back inside, Nikki passes Davey's parents who exi find Davey staring after her, still in a stupor. INT. RANDALL’S CAR - HOURS LATER The family drives in silence. Exhausted from giving a pol report, and from the depth of depravity they’re faced wit Davey meets Randall’s gaze IN THE REARVIEW MIRROR... And Randall dissolves to tears. Sheila leans over on Randall, embracing him as he drives, tears in her eyes. Davey lets it all wash over him -- The fear, the anger, t sorrow, the unadulterated reality of what’s happened. Tea stream down his face as he looks back up to meet -- RANDALL'S RELIEVED EYES, in the REARVIEW once more.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Davey. I love you, pal. Proud of you. Real proud. Sheila reaches back, squeezes Davey’s hand as --  99. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - LATER Davey’s perched atop his bed, staring out the picture win BLUE AND RED LIGHT flickering on his face from outside.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And Davey’s got the sleeping bag all set up for ya -- Woody, Sheila and Randall enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: -- when your mom gets off her shift in the morning, she’ll pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. and Mrs. Armstrong. Randall and Woody join Davey at the window. Look out to s the beehive of activity below -- POLICE CRUISERS crowd Mackey’s driveway. OFFICERS move in out of the house carrying BAGGED EVIDENCE. Another CRUISE sits parked at the end of Davey’s driveway. NEIGHBORS cro around, watching, gossiping.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You're safe, guys. They’ll keep an eye out, make sure nothing happens. Davey LOCKS HIS WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wonder where he is...

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: The A.P.B.’s been out for hours. Just a matter of time now. Davey climbs into bed as Woody settles in on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: We love you. You boys are gonna be the talk of the town. How’s it feel?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Like nothing’s ever gonna be the same again... Randall and Sheila kiss Davey on his head and exit. Once they’re gone, Davey looks back out the window at the acti at Mackey’s house. Woody joins him.  100.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Think they’1l catch him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There’s nowhere left for him to hide. It’s over. We got him. The boys give each other a high-five, crawl back into bed But as Davey lies down, he stares at the ceiling, worried

dialogues.speaker: HOURS LATER
dialogues.text: The boys have finally fallen asleep. WE TRACK THROUGH the room, OUT INTO THE -- HALLWAY. MOVING THROUGH the darkened house until we TILT ERRRRK... THE ATTIC DOOR QUIETLY OPENS, seemingly on its own... The slide-down ladder extends toward the floor... SHOE drops down, hits the first step. A COP’S SHOE. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Still asleep in his bed, Davey stirs a bit. Rolls over on side, back to the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: AND NOSE, MUFFLING HIS HYSTERICAL SCREAM
dialogues.text: DAVEY FIGHTS FOR A MOMENT... But his spirit is quickly sa thanks to the chemical’s handiwork. Davey looks into MACKEY’S EMPTY EYES as his own flutter s

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: The CONSTANT SUMMERTIME DRONE OF KATYDIDS AND CRICKETS... WAVES GENTLY WASHING ASHORE, not far away... A TUGBOAT HORN, far off in the distance... FLASHING LIGHTS, BLUE AND RED, through closed eyelids...

dialogues.speaker: BLINK-BLINK... BLINK... AS WE COME-TO, OUR VISION IS BLUR
dialogues.text: STROBING RED AND BLUE LIGHTS BLIND US. But AS OUR SIGHT CLEARS, we realize we’re in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey sits up quickly, panicked. Looks around. Where the am I? Realizes he’s in the back of a cop car, WINDOWS FOG UP. He’s bound at the wrists with rope and gagged. Beside him, Woody is out cold, bound and gagged as well.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (muffled, through gag) Woody! .... Woody! Davey leans into Woody, nudging him hard as he can -- WOO COMES-TO. Looks around -- FREAKED THE FUCK OUT, he bolts against the car door, BREATHING HARD. Davey moves his jaw and neck, makes his way out of the ga

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Turn around. I’1l untie you. Davey and Woody sit back-to-back. Davey struggles to loos the rope around Woody’s wrists. Finally unties it. Hands free, Woody removes his gag, unties Davey’s wrists --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Davey, what the fuck is going on!? I don’t even know how I got here --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s Mackey.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we!? They wipe the fog off the windows. Scan the darkness outs illuminated in bursts by the STROBING POLICE LIGHTS...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I can’t see shit! THUD! SOMETHING HEAVY HITS THE SIDE OF THE CAR -- The boy jump away from the windows, eyes darting every which way.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: The fuck was that!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything!  102.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHH
dialogues.text: SILENCE AGAIN. No signs of life. Just absolute stillness CRASH! A ROCK SHATTERS THE WINDOW BESIDE WOODY, shards of glass cutting the side of his face! They bolt to the othe side of the car, looking all around!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We need to get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No way! They listen intently, peering desperately into the woods through the fogged-up glass. Nothing in view. No movement The painful anticipation is shattered as -- THUD! The guys spin around to find -- MACKEY! HIS MANIACAL FACE just inches away! IN HIS HAND,

dialogues.speaker: RUUUUN
dialogues.text: AHHHH! Woody opens the door opposite Mackey, bolts out, D hot on his heels! They sprint for the surrounding woods a A POWERFUL FLASHLIGHT SLICES INTO THE WOODS AFTER THEM, i beam fractured, cascading across the trees. The boys peel into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (via cruiser loudspeaker) I know how much you guys like games. So I’ve got a surprise for you. As they run, the SOUND OF THE POLICE SIREN ECHOES OUT!

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (via cruiser loudspeaker) We’re gonna play Manhunt, only now, we’re gonna play for real! Davey and Woody stop, both leaning against a tree, out of breath, utterly petrified. Is this really happening!? Dav notices a PISS STAIN down Woody’s leg.  103.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hey. He won’t catch us if we keep moving. All right? Let’s go. SPRINTING THROUGH THE WOODS, the boys finally come to a clearing to find -- WATER! The dark, remote Ipswich Bay stares back at them! other land in sight!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What the hell...? Davey turns around to find MACKEY’S FLASHLIGHT BEAM IS GO He looks in all directions... Nothing! The SHRILL SCREAM THE POLICE SIREN just adds to the panic as --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Where’d he go!? Come on! Davey instinctively ducks back into the treeline, sprinti diagonally between the water and the police cruiser, its lights still flashing chaotically. The dense forest zips past as they dash through, adrenali pumping. They come to another clearing, revealing -- WATER! Again! Still no land in sight!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Where the fuck did he take us!?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (realizing, desolate) A barrier island. He knows no one comes out here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What? It can’t be an island! He drove his car! Woody crouches at the water line. Watches the movement of water in the moonlight...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Tide’s coming in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What’s that got to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I grew up clam digging with my Uncle around these islands. At low tide, there’s a road onto them. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOODY (CONT’D) At high tide, the road’s covered by water.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: If we don't find the road off the island soon, we're gonna be stranded out here til the tide goes back out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We have to go back to the cruiser. Follow the tracks. THE POLICE SIREN ABRUPTLY STOPS! KATYDIDS AND CRICKETS on again own the night. Waves gently wrestle with the shore.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He’s at the cruiser right now! We can’t go back there!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How deep is it? Can we swim?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: The undertow and rip tides are insane. We’d be as good as dead. These islands aren’t that big. If we just keep going around, eventually --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We’ll find the road. MOMENTS LATER, the guys are in a mad dash along the edge the island. The dense tree canopy blocks most of the ligh from the moon, just enough getting through to light the w Woody trips over SOMETHING, rolls his ankle, FALLS HARD. Davey comes to help Woody up, they both lock eyes on --

dialogues.speaker: AHHH --
dialogues.text: DAVEY BLOCKS WOODY’S MOUTH as they both fall away from th body, terrified! But they quickly realize THEY’RE IN A PU

dialogues.speaker: OF SLUDGE FROM ANOTHER DECOMPOSING BODY
dialogues.text: They slip and slide to their feet, backing away quickly. look around, speechless at the sight of --  105. BODIES, in varying stages of decomposition and burial. It impossible to tell, but there could easily be twenty of t Maybe more. IT’S MACKEY’S KILLING FIELD! Woody spots something. A FAMILIAR, EMPTY, STRIPED BAG. He kneels down. Sees that it’s --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: “Noah”... Empty bags of the stuff litter the ground --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Get down! MACKEY’S FLASHLIGHT PEEKS THROUGH THE TREE, not too far a Davey and Woody try to be as silent as possible, watching THE FLASHLIGHT MOVES CLOSER...

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know you’re close.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
