dialogues.text: We gotta get to the cruiser. Woody nods agreement, but suddenly dissolves into tears.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna die out here, Davey. My Mom needs me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You’re not gonna die. I got you into this mess, I’m gonna get you out of it. We’re gonna split up --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Why you always wanna split up?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We have to. Because I’m gonna be your diversion. I'll get Mackey’s attention so you can get to the cruiser. Find a way out.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna let you -- But before Woody can protest, DAVEY BOLTS --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Hey Wayne! Fuck you, you fuckin loser! Eat shit!  106.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY SPOTS HIM
dialogues.text: DAVEY RUNS LIKE HELL, FLASHLIGHT BEAM waving chaotically Mackey sprints after Davey, frenzied! Davey zig-zags through the brush! He’s never run faster i life, pure adrenaline coursing through his veins! Until - DAVEY TRIPS OVER A FALLEN TREE! Quickly pulls himself int the nook beneath it, GASPING FOR AIR! Quiets himself... SILENCE. Where the fuck is he!? Is he gone!? Did I lose him!? Shit... Davey slowly, hesitantly peeks out from under the tree --

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: AND THEN MACKEY’S THERE! IN DAVEY'’S FACE! He tears Davey from under the tree! THROWS HIM TO THE GROUND as he clean the blood off of his MASSIVE KNIFE!

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Stay the fuck there. Mackey takes off, disappearing into the night. Seriously injured and hobbled, tears form in Davey’s eyes. He muste his strength, SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: WOODY! HE’S COMING! RUUUUUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOODY. Racing through the dense overgrowth. TERRIFIED. He breaks free of some low hanging branches and stops. Se the SQUAD CAR about 50 yards ahead, LIGHTS still coloring night. Makes a dash for it -- WHAM! A BODY careens out of the shadows, SLAMS INTO WOODY They tumble over each other, whacking the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No! Please! Let me go! Landing face first, Woody WHEEZES in pain, the wind knock out of him. Before he can get up, a HAND GRABS HIS HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEEEEY
dialogues.text: AND A KNIFE SLITS HIS THROAT! !!!!!1}Piibbrrdbrrdrbage Woody's WHEEZING abruptly turns to a SURPRISED GURGLE. Still clutching Woody’s hair, Mackey gets down low over h Puts his head against Woody’s, face drawn in an expressio ecstasy as he PANTS hard and relishes the struggle of WOO FLAILING DEATH THROES. THE BOY’S FINAL, AGONIZING BREATHS When it’s over, Mackey stands, soaked in his prey’s blood Eyes closed in rapture, chest heaving, he smiles wide. Al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his feet, barely, Davey hobbles toward the RED AND BLU LIGHTS. Leg gushing blood, it drags behind him, useless. Teeth gritted, he GROWLS through the pain and tears. Urgi himself on. He finally sees the SQUAD CAR ahead -- THE BLINDING LIGHT OF A FLASHLIGHT CATCHES HIM. Coming closer... CLOSER... He crumples to his knees, SOBBING. MACKEY GRABS DAVEY. Crouches and draws him close. Their f just inches apart. Covered in blood except his big, brigh eyes, Mackey looks truly terrifying. He whips the KNIFE t Davey’s throat. Davey CRIES OUT in fear. HATRED MAKES MACKEY'S VOICE QUIVER. He digs the knife int Davey’s skin just a bit, DRAWS BLOOD -- Davey WHIMPERS.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: You brought this on yourself! All you had to do was leave me alone! This is

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (pleading) I’m sorry. I’m so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: Sorry? You forced me out of my home! Stole my life! And you think you can get out of this by saying you’re sorry!? All I want to do is kill you. I want you dead RIGHT FUCKING NOW! Davey winces! But the killing blow doesn’t come...  108.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: But that’s not enough. Not for you. Through the fear, Davey meets Mackey’s gaze. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: MACKEY
dialogues.text: You’ve spent so much time thinking about me. I want you to keep thinking about me and imagining what I’m going to do when I come back for you. And I will. After you’ve lived looking over your shoulder, seeing me in every dark corner, every nightmare. Live in the fear that every day might be the one I come back to claim what’s mine. One day... you’ll be right. Mackey shoves Davey to the ground. STOMPS ON DAVEY’S SLAS LEG. Davey SCREAMS in pain. Mackey smiles and turns back the darkness -- Davey CRIES OUT in pain, unable to move. After a few mome HE HEARS the squad car’s driver side door OPEN -- SLAM SH Davey struggles to sit up as the CAR’S ENGINE STARTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No -- Dirt and rocks kick up behind the car as it drives off in the night. THE RED AND BLUE LIGHTS FADING into the void - DAVEY’S FACE, alternating red and blue in the lights, is swallowed whole by the night as we --

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: SLOWLY FADE UP on STROBING LIGHTS. Distant and numerous. SOON REALIZE WE’RE LOOKING STRAIGHT DOWN FROM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALF A DOZEN POLICE CRUISERS, parked throughout the cul-d sac, their LIGHTS bathing the lawns and houses in blood r and crime scene blue.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET, CROWDED WITH NEIGHBORS AND COPS,
dialogues.text: THE EQUALLY CROWDED BACKYARDS, TO THE WOODS behind the houses. FLASHLIGHTS scour the darkness in all directions

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBORHOOD PARENTS
dialogues.text: (distant, echoing)

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s another Manhunt. As the PAN MOVES over the woods, we

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: SLOWLY FADE UP as HEADLIGHTS cut the darkness, revealing single, hobbling SILHOUETTE. It raises its arms, desperat help. The headlights slow. Stop as the silhouette collaps The driver's door opens and a FISHERMAN (male, 60s) jogs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, exhausted, barely holding onto consciousness, lies against the passenger window. Wrapped in a blanket. Pale shit. He might not make it to the hospital. The fisherman is doing his best to reassure Davey and kee him awake. WE CAN’T HEAR WHAT HE’S SAYING, but his expres is one of panic, SPEEDING as fast as he can. Davey stares out the window, in another world. The sun ju starting to rise, the sky turning from black to indigo bl He perks up a bit suddenly as the truck passes -- MACKEY’S SQUAD CAR. ABANDONED on the side of the road. AN FIRE, all its identifying marks scorching to oblivion. Davey’s head turns, watching it as they go by. Terror in eyes. Mackey’s long gone. Somewhere out there. Waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randall and Sheila hold Davey tight, the family all sitti on Davey’s hospital bed. CRYING together. Relieved. Broke EXT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAY Randall's CAR pulls into the driveway. NEWS REPORTERS and CAMERAMEN crowding the front porch rush to the car as -- Davey hobbles out, LEG IN A CAST.

dialogues.speaker: SEA OF REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Davey! /David!/Can you tell us what happened?/How’d you survive? Randall helps Davey along, shielding the boy as they reac Sheila and head inside, leaving the news folk clamoring a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BICYCLE TIRES spin quickly over the sidewalk. They slow t stop and a familiar SHOE drops to the pavement, the other foot in a SUPPORTIVE BOOT. Newspaper bag slung over his shoulder, Davey stands with bike at the foot of Mackey’s driveway. CRIME SCENE TAPE blocks the way up to the house, more of strung across the front door. But no police. The house wa searched and cleaned out long ago. He TOSSES A THICK SUNDAY NEWSPAPER on the asphalt at his feet. The headline reads: “CAPE ANN KILLER WAYNE MACKEY S ON THE LOOSE." Davey gazes at it a moment. Pedals on... He makes his way around the street, tossing NEWSPAPERS on front porches IN REVERSE OF THE ORDER AT THE OPEN. The yards are empty. Doors closed, probably locked. Curta drawn. No one watering their plants or playing games in t lawn. It’s all gone quiet. A neighborhood haunted by ghos

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When something you never saw coming breaks the routine... that’s when things get really interesting. The SOUNDS OF AN APPROACHING CAR make Davey stop. He look see it’s Nikki’s parents’ car. PACKED TO THE BRIM WITH NIKKI’S BELONGINGS. A UConn sticker on the fender. IN THE BACKSEAT WINDOW, Nikki looks out at Davey as the c passes. Davey gives her a solemn WAVE. She presses a hand the glass. The sad look on her face tells all. They hold other’s gaze until the car disappears from view...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But that’s what I love about this place. It always keeps you on your toes. Davey pedals on... As he throws a paper to Farraday’s por Davey spots Farraday looking out from his bedroom window. Farraday holds Davey’s gaze for a moment, remorse on his face. Then Francine comes to the window, closes the blind

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Behind the freshly painted walls next door, anything could be happening and you'd never know.  111. Passing Eats’ house, Davey looks into the side yard, sees Eats, Kyle and their father with CROWBARS. DISMANTLING TH TREEHOUSE. Davey stops to watch, gutpunched by the sight. Sees Eats’ solemn face as Eats pulls another board free.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Just past the manicured lawns and friendly waves, go inside any house. Less than fifty feet from where you sleep, entirely different lives are playing out. INT. DAVEY’S HOUSE - DAVEY’S ROOM - DAY Now devoid of all the childish toys and collectibles that once filled it. Davey stares at his walls, still covered National Enquirer pages. Tears in his eyes, in a fit of r he rakes his fingers down the wall and rips them all down

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s easy to think of the suburbs as a deadend. A weird Bermuda triangle where the American dream strangles all the excitement out of life. But looks can be deceiving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRONT PORCH LIGHTS GLEAM on every house. Giving a sense o security. Everything seems quiet. Safe.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Even serial killers live next door to somebody...
